briefdescription.para: Identify whether the core number computation should be based off incoming edges, outgoing edges or both.
Controls how we treat prior sources in sampling.

parameterdescription.para: Add vertices encounted while sampling to the new frontier
In addition to newly encountered vertices, include vertices used as sources in any previous frontier in the new frontier
Filter the new frontier to exclude any vertex that was used as a source in a previous frontier

memberdef.definition: rmm::device_uvector< weight_t > cugraph::betweenness_centrality
memberdef.argsstring: (const raft::handle_t &handle, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, std::optional< edge_property_view_t< edge_t, weight_t const * > > edge_weight_view, std::optional< raft::device_span< vertex_t const > > vertices, bool const normalized=true, bool const include_endpoints=false, bool const do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: betweenness_centrality

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &

briefdescription.para: Compute betweenness centrality for a graph.

detaileddescription.para: Betweenness centrality for a vertex is the sum of the fraction of all pairs shortest paths that pass through the vertex.
The current implementation does not support a weighted graph.
vertices is optional. If it is not specified the algorithm will compute exact betweenness (compute betweenness using a traversal from all vertices).
If vertices is specified as a device_span, it will compute approximate betweenness using the provided vertices as the seeds of the traversals.

parameterdescription.para: when an error occurs.
Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights. Needs to be a floating point type.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false)
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Graph view object.
Optional view object holding edge weights for graph_view. Currently, edge_weight_view.has_value() should be false as we don't support weighted graphs, yet.
Optional, if specified this provides a device_span identifying a list of pre-selected vertices to use as seeds for the traversals for approximating betweenness.
A flag indicating results should be normalized
A flag indicating whether endpoints of a path should be counted
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

simplesect.para: device vector containing the centralities.

memberdef.type: edge_property_t< graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu >, weight_t >
memberdef.definition: edge_property_t< graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu >, weight_t > cugraph::edge_betweenness_centrality
memberdef.argsstring: (const raft::handle_t &handle, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, std::optional< edge_property_view_t< edge_t, weight_t const * > > edge_weight_view, std::optional< raft::device_span< vertex_t const > > vertices, bool normalized=true, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: edge_betweenness_centrality

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &

briefdescription.para: Compute edge betweenness centrality for a graph.

detaileddescription.para: Betweenness centrality of an edge is the sum of the fraction of all-pairs shortest paths that pass through this edge. The weight parameter is currenlty not supported
vertices is optional. If it is not specified the algorithm will compute exact betweenness (compute betweenness using a traversal from all vertices).
If vertices is specified as a device_span, it will compute approximate betweenness using the provided vertices as the seeds of the traversals.

parameterdescription.para: when an error occurs.
Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights. Needs to be a floating point type.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false)
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Graph view object.
Optional view object holding edge weights for graph_view. Currently, edge_weight_view.has_value() should be false as we don't support weighted graphs, yet.
Optional, if specified this provides a device_span identifying a list of pre-selected vertices to use as seeds for the traversals for approximating betweenness.
A flag indicating whether or not to normalize the result
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

simplesect.para: edge_property_t containing the centralities.

memberdef.definition: rmm::device_uvector< weight_t > cugraph::eigenvector_centrality
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, true, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, std::optional< edge_property_view_t< edge_t, weight_t const * > > edge_weight_view, std::optional< raft::device_span< weight_t const > > initial_centralities, weight_t epsilon, size_t max_iterations=500, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: eigenvector_centrality

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, true, multi_gpu > const &

briefdescription.para: Compute Eigenvector Centrality scores.

detaileddescription.para: This function computes eigenvector centrality scores using the power method.

parameterdescription.para: on erroneous input arguments or if fails to converge before max_iterations.
Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights. Needs to be a floating point type.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false) or multi-GPU (true).
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Graph view object.
Optional view object holding edge weights for graph_view. If edge_weight_view.has_value() == false, edge weights are assumed to be 1.0.
Optional device span containing initial values for the eigenvector centralities

Error tolerance to check convergence. Convergence is assumed if the sum of the differences in eigenvector centrality values between two consecutive iterations is less than the number of vertices in the graph multiplied by epsilon.
Maximum number of power iterations.
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

simplesect.para: device vector containing the centralities.

memberdef.definition: void cugraph::katz_centrality
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, true, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, std::optional< edge_property_view_t< edge_t, weight_t const * > > edge_weight_view, result_t const *betas, result_t *katz_centralities, result_t alpha, result_t beta, result_t epsilon, size_t max_iterations=500, bool has_initial_guess=false, bool normalize=false, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: katz_centrality

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, true, multi_gpu > const &

briefdescription.para: Compute Katz Centrality scores.

detaileddescription.para: This function computes Katz Centrality scores.

parameterdescription.para: on erroneous input arguments or if fails to converge before max_iterations.
Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights. Needs to be a floating point type.
Type of Katz Centrality scores.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false) or multi-GPU (true).
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Graph view object.
Optional view object holding edge weights for graph_view. If edge_weight_view.has_value() == false, edge weights are assumed to be 1.0.
Pointer to an array holding the values to be added to each vertex's new Katz Centrality score in every iteration or nullptr. If set to nullptr, constant beta is used instead.
Pointer to the output Katz Centrality score array.
Katz Centrality attenuation factor. This should be smaller than the inverse of the maximum eigenvalue of the adjacency matrix of graph.
Constant value to be added to each vertex's new Katz Centrality score in every iteration. Relevant only when betas is nullptr.

Error tolerance to check convergence. Convergence is assumed if the sum of the differences in Katz Centrality values between two consecutive iterations is less than the number of vertices in the graph multiplied by epsilon.
Maximum number of Katz Centrality iterations.
If set to true, values in the Katz Centrality output array (pointed by katz_centralities) is used as initial Katz Centrality values. If false, zeros are used as initial Katz Centrality values.
If set to true, final Katz Centrality scores are normalized (the L2-norm of the returned Katz Centrality score array is 1.0) before returning.
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< int32_t, int32_t, true, true > const &graph_view, std::optional< edge_property_view_t< int32_t, float const * > > edge_weight_view, float const *betas, float *katz_centralities, float alpha, float beta, float epsilon, size_t max_iterations, bool has_initial_guess, bool normalize, bool do_expensive_check)

memberdef.definition: std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, size_t, weight_t > cugraph::ecg
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, raft::random::RngState &rng_state, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, std::optional< edge_property_view_t< edge_t, weight_t const * > > edge_weight_view, weight_t min_weight, size_t ensemble_size, size_t max_level=100, weight_t threshold=weight_t{1e-7}, weight_t resolution=weight_t{1})
memberdef.name: ecg

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &

briefdescription.para: Computes the ecg clustering of the given graph.

detaileddescription.para: ECG runs truncated Louvain on an ensemble of permutations of the input graph, then uses the ensemble partitions to determine weights for the input graph. The final result is found by running full Louvain on the input graph using the determined weights. See https://arxiv.org/abs/1809.05578 for further information.

parameterdescription.para: when an error occurs.
Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights. Needs to be a floating point type.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false)
Library handle (RAFT). If a communicator is set in the handle,
The RngState instance holding pseudo-random number generator state.
Input graph view object
View object holding edge weights for graph_view.
Minimum edge weight to use in the final call of the clustering algorithm if an edge does not appear in any of the ensemble runs.
The ensemble size parameter
(optional) maximum number of levels to run (default 100)
(optional) threshold for convergence at each level (default 1e-7)

(optional) The value of the resolution parameter to use. Called gamma in the modularity formula, this changes the size of the communities. Higher resolutions lead to more smaller communities, lower resolutions lead to fewer larger communities. (default 1)

simplesect.para: a tuple containing: 1) Device vector containing clustering result 2) number of levels of the returned clustering 3) modularity of the returned clustering

memberdef.type: template std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< int32_t >, size_t, float >

memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, std::optional< edge_property_view_t< edge_t, weight_t const * > > edge_weight_view, vertex_t *source_vertex, vertex_t n_subgraphs, vertex_t radius)
memberdef.name: extract_ego

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &

briefdescription.para: returns induced EgoNet subgraph(s) of neighbors centered at nodes in source_vertex within a given radius.

xrefdescription.para: This algorithm will be deprecated to replaced by the new version that uses the raft::device_span.

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights. Needs to be a floating point type.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false) or multi-GPU (true).
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms. Must have at least one worker stream.
Graph view object of, we extract induced egonet subgraphs from graph_view.
Optional view object holding edge weights for graph_view.
Pointer to egonet center vertices (size == n_subgraphs).
Number of induced EgoNet subgraphs to extract (ie. number of elements in source_vertex).
Include all neighbors of distance <= radius from source_vertex.

simplesect.para: Quadraplet of edge source vertices, edge destination vertices, edge weights (if edge_weight_view.has_value() == true), and edge offsets for each induced EgoNet subgraph.

memberdef.type: std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< weight_t > >, rmm::device_uvector< size_t > >
memberdef.definition: std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< weight_t > >, rmm::device_uvector< size_t > > cugraph::extract_ego
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, std::optional< edge_property_view_t< edge_t, weight_t const * > > edge_weight_view, raft::device_span< vertex_t const > source_vertices, vertex_t radius, bool do_expensive_check=false)

memberdef.definition: void cugraph::ecg
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, legacy::GraphCSRView< vertex_t, edge_t, weight_t > const &graph, weight_t min_weight, vertex_t ensemble_size, vertex_t *clustering)
memberdef.name: ecg

briefdescription.para: Computes the ecg clustering of the given graph.

detaileddescription.para: ECG runs truncated Louvain on an ensemble of permutations of the input graph, then uses the ensemble partitions to determine weights for the input graph. The final result is found by running full Louvain on the input graph using the determined weights. See https://arxiv.org/abs/1809.05578 for further information.

parameterdescription.para: when an error occurs.
Type of vertex identifiers. Supported value : int (signed, 32-bit)
Type of edge identifiers. Supported value : int (signed, 32-bit)
Type of edge weights. Supported values : float or double.
Library handle (RAFT). If a communicator is set in the handle,
input graph object (COO)
input graph object (CSR)
The minimum weight parameter
The ensemble size parameter
A device pointer to array where the partitioning should be written

memberdef.definition: template void cugraph::ecg< int32_t, int32_t, float >
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &, legacy::GraphCSRView< int32_t, int32_t, float > const &graph, float min_weight, int32_t ensemble_size, int32_t *clustering)

memberdef.definition: std::pair< std::unique_ptr< Dendrogram< vertex_t > >, weight_t > cugraph::leiden
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, raft::random::RngState &rng_state, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, std::optional< edge_property_view_t< edge_t, weight_t const * > > edge_weight_view, size_t max_level=100, weight_t resolution=weight_t{1}, weight_t theta=weight_t{1})
memberdef.name: leiden

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &

briefdescription.para: Leiden implementation.

detaileddescription.para: Compute a clustering of the graph by maximizing modularity using the Leiden improvements to the Louvain method.
Computed using the Leiden method described in:
Traag, V. A., Waltman, L., & van Eck, N. J. (2019). From Louvain to Leiden: guaranteeing well-connected communities. Scientific reports, 9(1), 5233. doi: 10.1038/s41598-019-41695-z

parameterdescription.para: when an error occurs.
Type of vertex identifiers. Supported value : int (signed, 32-bit)
Type of edge identifiers. Supported value : int (signed, 32-bit)
Type of edge weights. Supported values : float or double.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
The RngState instance holding pseudo-random number generator state.
Graph view object.
Optional view object holding edge weights for graph_view. If edge_weight_view.has_value() == false, edge weights are assumed to be 1.0.
(optional) maximum number of levels to run (default 100)

(optional) The value of the resolution parameter to use. Called gamma in the modularity formula, this changes the size of the communities. Higher resolutions lead to more smaller communities, lower resolutions lead to fewer larger communities. (default 1)

(optional) The value of the parameter to scale modularity gain in Leiden refinement phase. It is used to compute the probability of joining a random leiden community. Called theta in the Leiden algorithm.

simplesect.para: a pair containing: 1) unique pointer to dendrogram 2) modularity of the returned clustering

memberdef.name: flatten_leiden_dendrogram

briefdescription.para: Leiden implementation.

detaileddescription.para: Compute a clustering of the graph by maximizing modularity using the Leiden improvements to the Louvain method.
Computed using the Leiden method described in:
Traag, V. A., Waltman, L., & van Eck, N. J. (2019). From Louvain to Leiden: guaranteeing well-connected communities. Scientific reports, 9(1), 5233. doi: 10.1038/s41598-019-41695-z

parameterdescription.para: when an error occurs.
Type of vertex identifiers. Supported value : int (signed, 32-bit)
Type of edge identifiers. Supported value : int (signed, 32-bit)
Type of edge weights. Supported values : float or double.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
The RngState instance holding pseudo-random number generator state.
Graph view object.
Optional view object holding edge weights for graph_view. If edge_weight_view.has_value() == false, edge weights are assumed to be 1.0.
(optional) maximum number of levels to run (default 100)

(optional) The value of the resolution parameter to use. Called gamma in the modularity formula, this changes the size of the communities. Higher resolutions lead to more smaller communities, lower resolutions lead to fewer larger communities. (default 1)

(optional) The value of the parameter to scale modularity gain in Leiden refinement phase. It is used to compute the probability of joining a random leiden community. Called theta in the Leiden algorithm. communities. (default 1)

simplesect.para: a pair containing: 1) number of levels of the returned clustering 2) modularity of the returned clustering

memberdef.definition: std::pair< std::unique_ptr< Dendrogram< vertex_t > >, weight_t > cugraph::louvain
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, std::optional< std::reference_wrapper< raft::random::RngState > > rng_state, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, std::optional< edge_property_view_t< edge_t, weight_t const * > > edge_weight_view, size_t max_level=100, weight_t threshold=weight_t{1e-7}, weight_t resolution=weight_t{1})
memberdef.name: louvain

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &

briefdescription.para: Louvain implementation, returning dendrogram.

detaileddescription.para: Compute a clustering of the graph by maximizing modularity
Computed using the Louvain method described in:
VD Blondel, J-L Guillaume, R Lambiotte and E Lefebvre: Fast unfolding of community hierarchies in large networks, J Stat Mech P10008 (2008), http://arxiv.org/abs/0803.0476

parameterdescription.para: when an error occurs.
Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights. Needs to be a floating point type.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false)
Library handle (RAFT). If a communicator is set in the handle,
The RngState instance holding pseudo-random number generator state.
Input graph view object.
Optional view object holding edge weights for graph_view. If @pedge_weight_view.has_value() == false, edge weights are assumed to be 1.0.
(optional) maximum number of levels to run (default 100)
(optional) threshold for convergence at each level (default 1e-7)

(optional) The value of the resolution parameter to use. Called gamma in the modularity formula, this changes the size of the communities. Higher resolutions lead to more smaller communities, lower resolutions lead to fewer larger communities. (default 1)

simplesect.para: a pair containing: 1) unique pointer to dendrogram 2) modularity of the returned clustering

memberdef.definition: void cugraph::flatten_dendrogram
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, Dendrogram< vertex_t > const &dendrogram, vertex_t *clustering)
memberdef.name: flatten_dendrogram

memberdef.definition: std::pair< size_t, weight_t > cugraph::louvain
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, std::optional< std::reference_wrapper< raft::random::RngState > > rng_state, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, std::optional< edge_property_view_t< edge_t, weight_t const * > > edge_weight_view, vertex_t *clustering, size_t max_level=100, weight_t threshold=weight_t{1e-7}, weight_t resolution=weight_t{1})
memberdef.name: louvain

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &

briefdescription.para: Louvain implementation.

detaileddescription.para: Compute a clustering of the graph by maximizing modularity
Computed using the Louvain method described in:
VD Blondel, J-L Guillaume, R Lambiotte and E Lefebvre: Fast unfolding of community hierarchies in large networks, J Stat Mech P10008 (2008), http://arxiv.org/abs/0803.0476

parameterdescription.para: when an error occurs.
Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights. Needs to be a floating point type.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false)
Library handle (RAFT). If a communicator is set in the handle,
The RngState instance holding pseudo-random number generator state.
Input graph view object.
Optional view object holding edge weights for graph_view. If @pedge_weight_view.has_value() == false, edge weights are assumed to be 1.0.
Pointer to device array where the clustering should be stored
(optional) maximum number of levels to run (default 100)
(optional) threshold for convergence at each level (default 1e-7)

(optional) The value of the resolution parameter to use. Called gamma in the modularity formula, this changes the size of the communities. Higher resolutions lead to more smaller communities, lower resolutions lead to fewer larger communities. (default 1)

simplesect.para: a pair containing: 1) number of levels of the returned clustering 2) modularity of the returned clustering

memberdef.definition: void cugraph::connected_components
memberdef.argsstring: (legacy::GraphCSRView< VT, ET, WT > const &graph, cugraph_cc_t connectivity_type, VT *labels)
memberdef.name: connected_components

briefdescription.para: Compute connected components.

detaileddescription.para: The weak version (for undirected graphs, only) was imported from cuML. This implementation comes from [1] and solves component labeling problem in parallel on CSR-indexes based upon the vertex degree and adjacency graph.
[1] Hawick, K.A et al, 2010. "Parallel graph component labelling with GPUs and CUDA"
The strong version (for directed or undirected graphs) is based on: [2] Gilbert, J. et al, 2011. "Graph Algorithms in the Language of Linear Algebra"
C = I | A | A^2 |...| A^k where matrix multiplication is via semi-ring: (combine, reduce) == (&, |) (bitwise ops) Then: X = C & transpose(C); and finally, apply get_labels(X);

parameterdescription.para: when an error occurs.
Type of vertex identifiers. Supported value : int (signed, 32-bit)
Type of edge identifiers. Supported value : int (signed, 32-bit)
Type of edge weights. Supported values : float or double.
cuGraph graph descriptor, should contain the connectivity information as a CSR
STRONG or WEAK
Device array of component labels (labels[i] indicates the label associated with vertex id i.

memberdef.definition: template void cugraph::connected_components< int32_t, int32_t, float >
memberdef.argsstring: (legacy::GraphCSRView< int32_t, int32_t, float > const &, cugraph_cc_t, int32_t *)

memberdef.name: weakly_connected_components

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &

briefdescription.para: Finds (weakly-connected-)component IDs of each vertices in the input graph.

detaileddescription.para: The input graph must be symmetric. Component IDs can be arbitrary integers (they can be non-consecutive and are not ordered by component size or any other criterion).

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false) or multi-GPU (true).
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Graph view object.
Pointer to the output component ID array.
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

memberdef.definition: void cugraph::core_number
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, edge_t *core_numbers, k_core_degree_type_t degree_type, size_t k_first=0, size_t k_last=std::numeric_limits< size_t >::max(), bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: core_number

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &

briefdescription.para: Compute core numbers of individual vertices from K-Core decomposition.

detaileddescription.para: The input graph should not have self-loops nor multi-edges. Currently, only undirected graphs are supported.

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false) or multi-GPU (true).
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Graph view object.
Pointer to the output core number array.
Dictate whether to compute the K-Core decomposition based on in-degrees, out-degrees, or in-degrees + out_degrees.
Find K-Cores from K = k_first. Any vertices that do not belong to k_first-core will have core numbers of 0.
Find K-Cores to K = k_last. Any vertices that belong to (k_last)-core will have their core numbers set to their degrees on k_last-core.
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

memberdef.definition: std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< weight_t > > > cugraph::k_core
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, std::optional< edge_property_view_t< edge_t, weight_t const * > > edge_weight_view, size_t k, std::optional< k_core_degree_type_t > degree_type, std::optional< raft::device_span< edge_t const > > core_numbers, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: k_core

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &

briefdescription.para: Extract K-Core of a graph.

parameterdescription.para: when an error occurs.
Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights. Needs to be a floating point type.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false)
Graph view object.
Optional view object holding edge weights for graph_view.
Order of the core. This value must not be negative.
Optional parameter to dictate whether to compute the K-Core decomposition based on in-degrees, out-degrees, or in-degrees + out_degrees. One of degree_type and core_numbers must be specified.
Optional output from core_number algorithm. If not specified then k_core will call core_number itself using degree_type
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

simplesect.para: edge list for the graph

memberdef.definition: std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > > cugraph::generate_erdos_renyi_graph_edgelist_gnp
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, vertex_t num_vertices, float p, vertex_t base_vertex_id, uint64_t seed=0)
memberdef.name: generate_erdos_renyi_graph_edgelist_gnp

briefdescription.para: generate an edge lists for an Erdos-Renyi graph

detaileddescription.para: This API supports the G(n,p) model which requires O(n^2) work.
If executed in a multi-gpu context (handle comms has been initialized) each GPU will generate Erdos-Renyi edges for its portion of the 2D partitioning of the adjacency matrix.

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Number of vertices to use in the generated graph
Probability for edge creation
Starting vertex id for the generated graph
Seed value for the random number generator.

simplesect.para: std::tuple<rmm::device_uvector<vertex_t>, rmm::device_uvector<vertex_t>> A tuple of rmm::device_uvector objects for edge source vertex IDs and edge destination vertex IDs.

memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, vertex_t num_vertices, size_t m, vertex_t base_vertex_id, uint64_t seed=0)

detaileddescription.para: This API supports the G(n,m) model
If executed in a multi-gpu context (handle comms has been initialized) each GPU will generate Erdos-Renyi edges for its portion of the 2D partitioning of the adjacency matrix.

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.

Number of vertices to use in each complete graph
Number of edges to generate
Starting vertex id for the generated graph

memberdef.definition: std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > > cugraph::generate_bipartite_rmat_edgelist
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, raft::random::RngState &rng_state, size_t src_scale, size_t dst_scale, size_t num_edges, double a=0.57, double b=0.19, double c=0.19)
memberdef.name: generate_bipartite_rmat_edgelist

briefdescription.para: generate an edge list for a bipartite R-mat graph.

detaileddescription.para: The source vertex IDs will be in the range of [0, 2^src_scale) and the destination vertex IDs will be in the range of [0, 2^dst_scale). This function allows multi-edges.

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
RAFT RNG state, updated with each call
Scale factor to set the range of source vertex IDs (or the first vertex set) in the bipartite graph. Vertex IDs have values in [0, V_src), where V_src = 1 << src_scale.
Scale factor to set the range of destination vertex IDs (or the second vertex set) in the bipartite graph. Vertex IDs have values in [0, V_dst), where V_dst = 1 << dst_scale.
Number of edges to generate.
a, b, c, d (= 1.0 - (a + b + c)) in the R-mat graph generator (vist https://graph500.org for additional details). a, b, c, d should be non-negative and a + b + c should be no larger than 1.0.
a, b, c, d (= 1.0 - (a + b + c)) in the R-mat graph generator (vist https://graph500.org for additional details). a, b, c, d should be non-negative and a + b + c should be no larger than 1.0.
a, b, c, d (= 1.0 - (a + b + c)) in the R-mat graph generator (vist https://graph500.org for additional details). a, b, c, d should be non-negative and a + b + c should be no larger than 1.0.

simplesect.para: std::tuple<rmm::device_uvector<vertex_t>, rmm::device_uvector<vertex_t>> A tuple of rmm::device_uvector objects for edge source vertex IDs and edge destination vertex IDs.

memberdef.type: template std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< int32_t >, rmm::device_uvector< int32_t > >

memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, raft::random::RngState &rng_state, size_t src_scale, size_t dst_scale, size_t num_edges, double a, double b, double c)

memberdef.definition: std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > > cugraph::generate_rmat_edgelist
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, raft::random::RngState &rng_state, size_t scale, size_t num_edges, double a=0.57, double b=0.19, double c=0.19, bool clip_and_flip=false, bool scramble_vertex_ids=false)
memberdef.name: generate_rmat_edgelist

briefdescription.para: generate an edge list for an R-mat graph.

detaileddescription.para: This function allows multi-edges and self-loops similar to the Graph 500 reference implementation.

NOTE: The scramble_vertex_ids function needs to be called in order to generate a graph conforming to the Graph 500 specification (note that scrambling does not affect cuGraph's graph construction performance, so this is generally unnecessary). If edge_factor is given (e.g. Graph 500), set num_edges to (size_t{1} << scale) * edge_factor. To generate an undirected graph, set b == c and clip_and_flip = true. All the resulting edges will be placed in the lower triangular part (including the diagonal) of the graph adjacency matrix.

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
RAFT RNG state, updated with each call
Scale factor to set the number of vertices in the graph. Vertex IDs have values in [0, V), where V = 1 << scale.
Number of edges to generate.
a, b, c, d (= 1.0 - (a + b + c)) in the R-mat graph generator (vist https://graph500.org for additional details). a, b, c, d should be non-negative and a + b + c should be no larger than 1.0.
a, b, c, d (= 1.0 - (a + b + c)) in the R-mat graph generator (vist https://graph500.org for additional details). a, b, c, d should be non-negative and a + b + c should be no larger than 1.0.
a, b, c, d (= 1.0 - (a + b + c)) in the R-mat graph generator (vist https://graph500.org for additional details). a, b, c, d should be non-negative and a + b + c should be no larger than 1.0.
Flag controlling whether to generate edges only in the lower triangular part (including the diagonal) of the graph adjacency matrix (if set to true) or not (if set to false).
Flag controlling whether to scramble vertex ID bits (if set to true) or not (if set to false); scrambling vertex ID bits breaks correlation between vertex ID values and vertex degrees.

simplesect.para: std::tuple<rmm::device_uvector<vertex_t>, rmm::device_uvector<vertex_t>> A tuple of rmm::device_uvector objects for edge source vertex IDs and edge destination vertex IDs.

memberdef.definition: std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > > cugraph::generate_rmat_edgelist
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, size_t scale, size_t num_edges, double a=0.57, double b=0.19, double c=0.19, uint64_t seed=0, bool clip_and_flip=false, bool scramble_vertex_ids=false)
memberdef.name: generate_rmat_edgelist

briefdescription.para: generate an edge list for an R-mat graph.

xrefdescription.para: This function will be deprectated and should be replaced with the version that takes raft::random::RngState as a parameter

detaileddescription.para: This function allows multi-edges and self-loops similar to the Graph 500 reference implementation.

NOTE: The scramble_vertex_ids function needs to be called in order to generate a graph conforming to the Graph 500 specification (note that scrambling does not affect cuGraph's graph construction performance, so this is generally unnecessary). If edge_factor is given (e.g. Graph 500), set num_edges to (size_t{1} << scale) * edge_factor. To generate an undirected graph, set b == c and clip_and_flip = true. All the resulting edges will be placed in the lower triangular part (including the diagonal) of the graph adjacency matrix.

For multi-GPU generation with P GPUs, seed should be set to different values in different GPUs to avoid every GPU generating the same set of edges. num_edges should be adjusted as well; e.g. assuming edge_factor is given, set num_edges = (size_t{1} << scale) * edge_factor / P + (rank < (((size_t{1} << scale) * edge_factor) % P) ? 1 : 0).

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Scale factor to set the number of verties in the graph. Vertex IDs have values in [0, V), where V = 1 << scale.
Number of edges to generate.
a, b, c, d (= 1.0 - (a + b + c)) in the R-mat graph generator (vist https://graph500.org for additional details). a, b, c, d should be non-negative and a + b + c should be no larger than 1.0.
a, b, c, d (= 1.0 - (a + b + c)) in the R-mat graph generator (vist https://graph500.org for additional details). a, b, c, d should be non-negative and a + b + c should be no larger than 1.0.
a, b, c, d (= 1.0 - (a + b + c)) in the R-mat graph generator (vist https://graph500.org for additional details). a, b, c, d should be non-negative and a + b + c should be no larger than 1.0.
Seed value for the random number generator.
Flag controlling whether to generate edges only in the lower triangular part (including the diagonal) of the graph adjacency matrix (if set to true) or not (if set to false).
Flag controlling whether to scramble vertex ID bits (if set to true) or not (if set to false); scrambling vertex ID bits breaks correlation between vertex ID values and vertex degrees.

simplesect.para: std::tuple<rmm::device_uvector<vertex_t>, rmm::device_uvector<vertex_t>> A tuple of rmm::device_uvector objects for edge source vertex IDs and edge destination vertex IDs.

memberdef.type: std::vector< std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > > >
memberdef.definition: std::vector< std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > > > cugraph::generate_rmat_edgelists
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, raft::random::RngState &rng_state, size_t n_edgelists, size_t min_scale, size_t max_scale, size_t edge_factor=16, generator_distribution_t size_distribution=generator_distribution_t::POWER_LAW, generator_distribution_t edge_distribution=generator_distribution_t::POWER_LAW, bool clip_and_flip=false, bool scramble_vertex_ids=false)
memberdef.name: generate_rmat_edgelists

briefdescription.para: generate multiple edge lists using the R-mat graph generator.

detaileddescription.para: This function allows multi-edges and self-loops similar to the Graph 500 reference implementation.

NOTE: The scramble_vertex_ids function needs to be called in order to generate a graph conforming to the Graph 500 specification (note that scrambling does not affect cuGraph's graph construction performance, so this is generally unnecessary). If edge_factor is given (e.g. Graph 500), set num_edges to (size_t{1} << scale) * edge_factor. To generate an undirected graph, set b == c and clip_and_flip = true. All the resulting edges will be placed in the lower triangular part (including the diagonal) of the graph adjacency matrix.

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
RAFT RNG state, updated with each call
Number of edge lists (graphs) to generate
Scale factor to set the minimum number of verties in the graph.
Scale factor to set the maximum number of verties in the graph.
Average number of edges per vertex to generate.
Distribution of the graph sizes, impacts the scale parameter of the R-MAT generator
Edges distribution for each graph, impacts how R-MAT parameters a,b,c,d, are set.
Flag controlling whether to generate edges only in the lower triangular part (including the diagonal) of the graph adjacency matrix (if set to true) or not (if set to false).
Flag controlling whether to scramble vertex ID bits (if set to true) or not (if set to false); scrambling vertex ID bits breaks correlation between vertex ID values and vertex degrees.

simplesect.para: A vector of std::tuple<rmm::device_uvector<vertex_t>, rmm::device_uvector<vertex_t>> of size n_edgelists, each vector element being a tuple of rmm::device_uvector objects for edge source vertex IDs and edge destination vertex IDs.

memberdef.type: std::vector< std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > > >
memberdef.definition: std::vector< std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > > > cugraph::generate_rmat_edgelists
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, size_t n_edgelists, size_t min_scale, size_t max_scale, size_t edge_factor=16, generator_distribution_t size_distribution=generator_distribution_t::POWER_LAW, generator_distribution_t edge_distribution=generator_distribution_t::POWER_LAW, uint64_t seed=0, bool clip_and_flip=false, bool scramble_vertex_ids=false)
memberdef.name: generate_rmat_edgelists

briefdescription.para: generate multiple edge lists using the R-mat graph generator.

xrefdescription.para: This function will be deprectated and should be replaced with the version that takes raft::random::RngState as a parameter

detaileddescription.para: This function allows multi-edges and self-loops similar to the Graph 500 reference implementation.

NOTE: The scramble_vertex_ids function needs to be called in order to generate a graph conforming to the Graph 500 specification (note that scrambling does not affect cuGraph's graph construction performance, so this is generally unnecessary). If edge_factor is given (e.g. Graph 500), set num_edges to (size_t{1} << scale) * edge_factor. To generate an undirected graph, set b == c and clip_and_flip = true. All the resulting edges will be placed in the lower triangular part (including the diagonal) of the graph adjacency matrix.

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Number of edge lists (graphs) to generate
Scale factor to set the minimum number of verties in the graph.
Scale factor to set the maximum number of verties in the graph.
Average number of edges per vertex to generate.
Distribution of the graph sizes, impacts the scale parameter of the R-MAT generator
Edges distribution for each graph, impacts how R-MAT parameters a,b,c,d, are set.
Seed value for the random number generator.
Flag controlling whether to generate edges only in the lower triangular part (including the diagonal) of the graph adjacency matrix (if set to true) or not (if set to false).
Flag controlling whether to scramble vertex ID bits (if set to true) or not (if set to false); scrambling vertex ID bits breaks correlation between vertex ID values and vertex degrees.

simplesect.para: A vector of std::tuple<rmm::device_uvector<vertex_t>, rmm::device_uvector<vertex_t>> of size n_edgelists, each vector element being a tuple of rmm::device_uvector objects for edge source vertex IDs and edge destination vertex IDs.

memberdef.definition: rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > cugraph::scramble_vertex_ids

memberdef.name: scramble_vertex_ids

briefdescription.para: scramble vertex IDs in a graph

detaileddescription.para: Given a vertex list for a graph, scramble the input vertex IDs.
The scramble code here follows the algorithm in the Graph 500 reference implementation version 3.0.0.

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Vector of input vertices
The input & output (scrambled) vertex IDs are assumed to be in [0, 2^lgN).

simplesect.para: rmm::device_uvector object storing scrambled vertex IDs.

memberdef.definition: std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > > cugraph::scramble_vertex_ids
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > &&srcs, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > &&dsts, size_t lgN)
memberdef.name: scramble_vertex_ids

briefdescription.para: scramble vertex ids in a graph

detaileddescription.para: Given an edge list for a graph, scramble the input vertex IDs.
The scramble code here follows the algorithm in the Graph 500 reference implementation version 3.0.0.

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Vector of input source vertices
Vector of input destination vertices
The input & output (scrambled) vertex IDs are assumed to be in [0, 2^lgN).

simplesect.para: Tuple of two rmm::device_uvector objects storing scrambled source & destination vertex IDs, respectively.

memberdef.name: combine_edgelists

briefdescription.para: Combine edgelists from multiple sources into a single edgelist.

detaileddescription.para: If executed in a multi-gpu context (handle comms has been initialized) each GPU will operate only on its subset of data. Any shuffling to get edges onto the same GPU should be done prior to calling this function.

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
The source vertex ids to combine
The destination vertex ids to combine
Optional vector of weights to combine
If true (the default) then remove multi edges, if false leave them in

simplesect.para: std::tuple<rmm::device_uvector<vertex_t>, rmm::device_uvector<vertex_t>, rmm::device_uvector<weight_t>> A tuple of rmm::device_uvector objects for edge source vertex IDs and edge destination vertex IDs and edge weights.

memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > &&d_src_v, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > &&d_dst_v, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< weight_t > > &&optional_d_weights_v, bool check_diagonal=false)
memberdef.name: symmetrize_edgelist_from_triangular

briefdescription.para: symmetrize an edgelist from the edges in the lower (or upper but not both) triangular part of a graph adjacency matrix

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of weights.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Vector of source vertices
Vector of destination vertices
Optional vector of edge weights
Flag indicating whether to check for diagonal edges or not. If set to true, symmetrize only the edges with source != destination (to avoid duplicating every self-loops).

simplesect.para: std::tuple<rmm::device_uvector<vertex_t>, rmm::device_uvector<vertex_t>> A tuple of rmm::device_uvector objects for edge source vertex IDs and edge destination vertex IDs.

memberdef.definition: std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > > cugraph::generate_path_graph_edgelist
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, std::vector< std::tuple< vertex_t, vertex_t > > const &component_parameters_v)
memberdef.name: generate_path_graph_edgelist

briefdescription.para: generate an edge list for path graph

detaileddescription.para: A path graph of size n connects the vertices from 0 to (n - 1) in a single long path: ((0,1), (1,2), ..., (n - 2, n - 1)
If executed in a multi-gpu context (handle comms has been initialized) the path will span all GPUs including an edge from the last vertex on GPU i to the first vertex on GPU (i+1)

This function will generate a collection of path graphs. component_parameters_v defines the parameters for generating each component. Each element of component_parameters_v defines a tuple consisting of the number of vertices and the base vertex id for the component.

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
A vector containing tuples consisting of the number of vertices and base vertex id for each component to generate.

simplesect.para: std::tuple<rmm::device_uvector<vertex_t>, rmm::device_uvector<vertex_t>> A tuple of rmm::device_uvector objects for edge source vertex IDs and edge destination vertex IDs.

briefdescription.para: generate an edge list for a 2D Mesh Graph

detaileddescription.para: A sequence of 2D mesh graphs will be constructed according to the component specifications. Each 2D mesh graph is configured with a tuple containing (x, y, base_vertex_id). component_parameters_v will contain a tuple for each component.
If executed in a multi-gpu context (handle comms has been initialized) each GPU will generate disjoint 2D mesh constructs of equal size.

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Vector containing tuple defining the configuration of each component

simplesect.para: std::tuple<rmm::device_uvector<vertex_t>, rmm::device_uvector<vertex_t>> A tuple of rmm::device_uvector objects for edge source vertex IDs and edge destination vertex IDs.

memberdef.definition: void cugraph::force_atlas2
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, legacy::GraphCOOView< vertex_t, edge_t, weight_t > &graph, float *pos, const int max_iter=500, float *x_start=nullptr, float *y_start=nullptr, bool outbound_attraction_distribution=true, bool lin_log_mode=false, bool prevent_overlapping=false, const float edge_weight_influence=1.0, const float jitter_tolerance=1.0, bool barnes_hut_optimize=true, const float barnes_hut_theta=0.5, const float scaling_ratio=2.0, bool strong_gravity_mode=false, const float gravity=1.0, bool verbose=false, internals::GraphBasedDimRedCallback *callback=nullptr)
memberdef.name: force_atlas2

briefdescription.para: ForceAtlas2 is a continuous graph layout algorithm for handy network visualization.

para.verbatim: NOTE: Peak memory allocation occurs at 17*V.

parameterdescription.para: when an error occurs.
Type of vertex identifiers. Supported value : int (signed, 32-bit)
Type of edge identifiers. Supported value : int (signed, 32-bit)
Type of edge weights. Supported values : float or double.
Library handle (RAFT). If a communicator is set in the handle, the multi GPU version will be selected.
cuGraph graph descriptor, should contain the connectivity information as a COO. Graph is considered undirected. Edge weights are used for this algorithm and set to 1 by default.
Device array (2, n) containing x-axis and y-axis positions;
The maximum number of iterations Force Atlas 2 should run for.
Device array containing starting x-axis positions;
Device array containing starting y-axis positions;
Distributes attraction along outbound edges. Hubs attract less and thus are pushed to the borders.
Switch ForceAtlas model from lin-lin to lin-log (tribute to Andreas Noack). Makes clusters more tight.
Prevent nodes from overlapping.
How much influence you give to the edges weight. 0 is no influence and 1 is normal.
How much swinging you allow. Above 1 discouraged. Lower gives less speed and more precision.
Whether to use the Barnes Hut approximation or the slower exact version.

Float between 0 and 1. Tradeoff for speed (1) vs accuracy (0) for Barnes Hut only. @params[in] scaling_ratio Float strictly positive. How much repulsion you want. More makes a more sparse graph. Switching from regular mode to LinLog mode needs a readjustment of the scaling parameter. @params[in] strong_gravity_mode Sets a force that attracts the nodes that are distant from the center more. It is so strong that it can sometimes dominate other forces. @params[in] gravity Attracts nodes to the center. Prevents islands from drifting away. @params[in] verbose Output convergence info at each interation. @params[in] callback An instance of GraphBasedDimRedCallback class to intercept the internal state of positions while they are being trained.

memberdef.definition: template void cugraph::force_atlas2< int, int, float >
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, legacy::GraphCOOView< int, int, float > &graph, float *pos, const int max_iter, float *x_start, float *y_start, bool outbound_attraction_distribution, bool lin_log_mode, bool prevent_overlapping, const float edge_weight_influence, const float jitter_tolerance, bool barnes_hut_optimize, const float barnes_hut_theta, const float scaling_ratio, bool strong_gravity_mode, const float gravity, bool verbose, internals::GraphBasedDimRedCallback *callback)
memberdef.name: force_atlas2< int, int, float >

memberdef.definition: template void cugraph::force_atlas2< int, int, double >
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, legacy::GraphCOOView< int, int, double > &graph, float *pos, const int max_iter, float *x_start, float *y_start, bool outbound_attraction_distribution, bool lin_log_mode, bool prevent_overlapping, const float edge_weight_influence, const float jitter_tolerance, bool barnes_hut_optimize, const float barnes_hut_theta, const float scaling_ratio, bool strong_gravity_mode, const float gravity, bool verbose, internals::GraphBasedDimRedCallback *callback)

memberdef.definition: weight_t cugraph::hungarian
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, legacy::GraphCOOView< vertex_t, edge_t, weight_t > const &graph, vertex_t num_workers, vertex_t const *workers, vertex_t *assignments)
memberdef.name: hungarian

briefdescription.para: Compute Hungarian algorithm on a weighted bipartite graph.

detaileddescription.para: The Hungarian algorithm computes an assigment of "jobs" to "workers". This function accepts a weighted graph and a vertex list identifying the "workers". The weights in the weighted graph identify the cost of assigning a particular job to a worker. The algorithm computes a minimum cost assignment and returns the cost as well as a vector identifying the assignment.

parameterdescription.para: when an error occurs.
Type of vertex identifiers. Supported value : int (signed, 32-bit)
Type of edge identifiers. Supported value : int (signed, 32-bit)
Type of edge weights. Supported values : float or double.
Library handle (RAFT). If a communicator is set in the handle,
cuGRAPH COO graph
number of vertices in the worker set
device pointer to an array of worker vertex ids
device pointer to an array to which the assignment will be written. The array should be num_workers long, and will identify which vertex id (job) is assigned to that worker

memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, legacy::GraphCOOView< vertex_t, edge_t, weight_t > const &graph, vertex_t num_workers, vertex_t const *workers, vertex_t *assignments, weight_t epsilon)

memberdef.definition: std::tuple< result_t, size_t > cugraph::hits
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, true, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, result_t *hubs, result_t *authorities, result_t epsilon, size_t max_iterations, bool has_initial_hubs_guess, bool normalize, bool do_expensive_check)
memberdef.name: hits

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, true, multi_gpu > const &

briefdescription.para: Compute HITS scores.

detaileddescription.para: This function computes HITS scores for the vertices of a graph

parameterdescription.para: on erroneous input arguments
Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false) or multi-GPU (true).
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Graph view object.
Pointer to the input/output hub score array.
Pointer to the output authorities score array.
Error tolerance to check convergence. Convergence is assumed if the sum of the differences in hub values between two consecutive iterations is less than epsilon
Maximum number of HITS iterations.
If set to true, values in the hubs output array (pointed by hubs) is used as initial hub values. If false, initial hub values are set to 1.0 divided by the number of vertices in the graph.
If set to true, final hub and authority scores are normalized (the L1-norm of the returned hub and authority score arrays is 1.0) before returning.
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

simplesect.para: std::tuple<result_t, size_t> A tuple of sum of the differences of hub scores of the last two iterations and the total number of iterations taken to reach the final result

memberdef.definition: void cugraph::pagerank
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, true, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, std::optional< edge_property_view_t< edge_t, weight_t const * > > edge_weight_view, std::optional< weight_t const * > precomputed_vertex_out_weight_sums, std::optional< vertex_t const * > personalization_vertices, std::optional< result_t const * > personalization_values, std::optional< vertex_t > personalization_vector_size, result_t *pageranks, result_t alpha, result_t epsilon, size_t max_iterations=500, bool has_initial_guess=false, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: pagerank

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, true, multi_gpu > const &

briefdescription.para: Compute PageRank scores.

xrefdescription.para: This API will be deprecated to replaced by the new version below that returns metadata about the algorithm.

detaileddescription.para: This function computes general (if personalization_vertices is nullptr) or personalized (if personalization_vertices is not nullptr.) PageRank scores.

parameterdescription.para: on erroneous input arguments or if fails to converge before max_iterations.
Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights. Needs to be a floating point type.
Type of PageRank scores.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false) or multi-GPU (true).
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Graph view object.
Optional view object holding edge weights for graph_view. If edge_weight_view.has_value() == false, edge weights are assumed to be 1.0.

Pointer to an array storing sums of out-going edge weights for the vertices (for re-use) or std::nullopt. If std::nullopt, these values are freshly computed. Computing these values outside this function reduces the number of memory allocations/deallocations and computing if a user repeatedly computes PageRank scores using the same graph with different personalization vectors.
Pointer to an array storing personalization vertex identifiers (compute personalized PageRank) or std::nullopt (compute general PageRank).
Pointer to an array storing personalization values for the vertices in the personalization set. Relevant only if personalization_vertices is not std::nullopt.

Size of the personalization set. If @personalization_vertices is not std::nullopt, the sizes of the arrays pointed by personalization_vertices and personalization_values should be personalization_vector_size.
Pointer to the output PageRank score array.
PageRank damping factor.

Error tolerance to check convergence. Convergence is assumed if the sum of the differences in PageRank values between two consecutive iterations is less than the number of vertices in the graph multiplied by epsilon.
Maximum number of PageRank iterations.

If set to true, values in the PageRank output array (pointed by pageranks) is used as initial PageRank values. If false, initial PageRank values are set to 1.0 divided by the number of vertices in the graph.
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

memberdef.definition: std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< result_t >, centrality_algorithm_metadata_t > cugraph::pagerank
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, true, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, std::optional< edge_property_view_t< edge_t, weight_t const * > > edge_weight_view, std::optional< raft::device_span< weight_t const > > precomputed_vertex_out_weight_sums, std::optional< std::tuple< raft::device_span< vertex_t const >, raft::device_span< result_t const > > > personalization, std::optional< raft::device_span< result_t const > > initial_pageranks, result_t alpha, result_t epsilon, size_t max_iterations=500, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: pagerank

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, true, multi_gpu > const &
std::optional< std::tuple< raft::device_span< vertex_t const >, raft::device_span< result_t const > > >

briefdescription.para: Compute PageRank scores.

detaileddescription.para: This function computes general (if personalization_vertices is nullptr) or personalized (if personalization_vertices is not nullptr.) PageRank scores.

parameterdescription.para: on erroneous input arguments or if fails to converge before max_iterations.
Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights. Needs to be a floating point type.
Type of PageRank scores.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false) or multi-GPU (true).
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Graph view object.
Optional view object holding edge weights for graph_view. If edge_weight_view.has_value() == false, edge weights are assumed to be 1.0.

Pointer to an array storing sums of out-going edge weights for the vertices (for re-use) or std::nullopt. If std::nullopt, these values are freshly computed. Computing these values outside this function reduces the number of memory allocations/deallocations and computing if a user repeatedly computes PageRank scores using the same graph with different personalization vectors.
Optional tuple containing device spans of vertex identifiers and personalization values for the vertices (compute personalized PageRank) or std::nullopt (compute general PageRank).

Optional device span containing initial PageRank values. If specified this array will be used as the initial values and the PageRank values will be updated in place. If not specified then the initial values will be set to 1.0 divided by the number of vertices in the graph and the return value will contain an rmm::device_uvector containing the resulting PageRank values.
PageRank damping factor.

Error tolerance to check convergence. Convergence is assumed if the sum of the differences in PageRank values between two consecutive iterations is less than the number of vertices in the graph multiplied by epsilon.
Maximum number of PageRank iterations.
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

simplesect.para: tuple containing the optional pagerank results (populated if initial_pageranks is set to std::nullopt) and a metadata structure with metadata indicating how many iterations were run and whether the algorithm converged or not.

memberdef.definition: rmm::device_uvector< weight_t > cugraph::jaccard_coefficients
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, std::optional< edge_property_view_t< edge_t, weight_t const * > > edge_weight_view, std::tuple< raft::device_span< vertex_t const >, raft::device_span< vertex_t const > > vertex_pairs, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: jaccard_coefficients

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &
std::tuple< raft::device_span< vertex_t const >, raft::device_span< vertex_t const > >

briefdescription.para: Compute Jaccard similarity coefficient.

detaileddescription.para: Similarity is computed for every pair of vertices specified. Note that similarity algorithms expect a symmetric graph.

parameterdescription.para: when an error occurs.
Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights. Needs to be a floating point type.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false)
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Graph view object.
Optional view object holding edge weights for graph_view. If edge_weight_view.has_value() == true, use the weights associated with the graph. If false, assume a weight of 1 for all edges.
tuple of device spans defining the vertex pairs to compute similarity for In a multi-gpu context each vertex pair should be local to this GPU.
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

simplesect.para: similarity coefficient for the corresponding vertex_pairs

memberdef.type: std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< weight_t > >
memberdef.definition: std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< weight_t > > cugraph::jaccard_all_pairs_coefficients
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, std::optional< edge_property_view_t< edge_t, weight_t const * > > edge_weight_view, std::optional< raft::device_span< vertex_t const > > vertices, std::optional< size_t > topk, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: jaccard_all_pairs_coefficients

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &

briefdescription.para: Compute Jaccard all pairs similarity coefficient.

detaileddescription.para: Similarity is computed for all pairs of vertices. Note that in a sparse graph, many of the vertex pairs will have a score of zero. We actually compute similarity only for vertices that are two hop neighbors within the graph, since vertices that are not two hop neighbors will have a score of 0.
If vertices is specified we will compute similarity on two hop neighbors the vertices. If vertices is not specified it will compute similarity on all two hop neighbors in the graph.
If topk is specified only the top topk scoring vertex pairs will be returned, if not specified then scores for all computed vertex pairs will be returned.

Note the list of two hop neighbors in the entire graph might be a large number of vertex pairs. If the graph is dense enough it could be as large as the the number of vertices squared, which might run out of memory.

parameterdescription.para: when an error occurs.
Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights. Needs to be a floating point type.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false)
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Graph view object.
Optional view object holding edge weights for graph_view. If edge_weight_view.has_value() == true, use the weights associated with the graph. If false, assume a weight of 1 for all edges.
optional device span defining the seed vertices. In a multi-gpu context the vertices should be local to this GPU.
optional specification of the how many of the top scoring vertex pairs should be returned
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

simplesect.para: tuple containing three device vectors (v1, v2, score) of the same length. Corresponding elements in the vectors identify a result, v1 identifying a vertex in the graph, v2 identifying one of v1's two hop neighors, and the score identifying the similarity score between v1 and v2. If topk was specified then the vectors will be no longer than topk elements. In a multi-gpu context, if topk is specified all results will return on GPU rank 0, otherwise they will be returned on the local GPU for vertex v1.

memberdef.definition: template rmm::device_uvector< float > cugraph::jaccard_coefficients

memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, std::optional< edge_property_view_t< edge_t, weight_t const * > > edge_weight_view, std::tuple< raft::device_span< vertex_t const >, raft::device_span< vertex_t const > > vertex_pairs, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: overlap_coefficients

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &
std::tuple< raft::device_span< vertex_t const >, raft::device_span< vertex_t const > >

briefdescription.para: Compute overlap similarity coefficient.

detaileddescription.para: Similarity is computed for every pair of vertices specified. Note that similarity algorithms expect a symmetric graph.

parameterdescription.para: when an error occurs.
Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights. Needs to be a floating point type.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false)
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Graph view object.
Optional view object holding edge weights for graph_view. If edge_weight_view.has_value() == true, use the weights associated with the graph. If false, assume a weight of 1 for all edges.
tuple of device spans defining the vertex pairs to compute similarity for
tuple of device spans defining the vertex pairs to compute similarity for In a multi-gpu context each vertex pair should be local to this GPU.
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

simplesect.para: similarity coefficient for the corresponding vertex_pairs

memberdef.type: std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< weight_t > >
memberdef.definition: std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< weight_t > > cugraph::overlap_all_pairs_coefficients
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, std::optional< edge_property_view_t< edge_t, weight_t const * > > edge_weight_view, std::optional< raft::device_span< vertex_t const > > vertices, std::optional< size_t > topk, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: overlap_all_pairs_coefficients

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &

briefdescription.para: Compute overlap similarity coefficient.

detaileddescription.para: Similarity is computed for all pairs of vertices. Note that in a sparse graph, many of the vertex pairs will have a score of zero. We actually compute similarity only for vertices that are two hop neighbors within the graph, since vertices that are not two hop neighbors will have a score of 0.
If vertices is specified we will compute similarity on two hop neighbors the vertices. If vertices is not specified it will compute similarity on all two hop neighbors in the graph.
If topk is specified only the top topk scoring vertex pairs will be returned, if not specified then scores for all computed vertex pairs will be returned.

Note the list of two hop neighbors in the entire graph might be a large number of vertex pairs. If the graph is dense enough it could be as large as the the number of vertices squared, which might run out of memory.

parameterdescription.para: when an error occurs.
Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights. Needs to be a floating point type.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false)
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Graph view object.
Optional view object holding edge weights for graph_view. If edge_weight_view.has_value() == true, use the weights associated with the graph. If false, assume a weight of 1 for all edges.
optional device span defining the seed vertices.
optional specification of the how many of the top scoring vertex pairs should be returned
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

simplesect.para: tuple containing three device vectors (v1, v2, score) of the same length. Corresponding elements in the vectors identify a result, v1 identifying a vertex in the graph, v2 identifying one of v1's two hop neighors, and the score identifying the similarity score between v1 and v2. If topk was specified then the vectors will be no longer than topk elements. In a multi-gpu context, if topk is specified all results will return on GPU rank 0, otherwise they will be returned on the local GPU for vertex v1.
