memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, std::optional< edge_property_view_t< edge_t, weight_t const * > > edge_weight_view, std::tuple< raft::device_span< vertex_t const >, raft::device_span< vertex_t const > > vertex_pairs, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: sorensen_coefficients

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &
std::tuple< raft::device_span< vertex_t const >, raft::device_span< vertex_t const > >

briefdescription.para: Compute Sorensen similarity coefficient.

detaileddescription.para: Similarity is computed for every pair of vertices specified. Note that similarity algorithms expect a symmetric graph.

parameterdescription.para: when an error occurs.
Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights. Needs to be a floating point type.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false)
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Graph view object.
Optional view object holding edge weights for graph_view. If edge_weight_view.has_value() == true, use the weights associated with the graph. If false, assume a weight of 1 for all edges.
tuple of device spans defining the vertex pairs to compute similarity for
tuple of device spans defining the vertex pairs to compute similarity for In a multi-gpu context each vertex pair should be local to this GPU.
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

simplesect.para: similarity coefficient for the corresponding vertex_pairs

memberdef.type: std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< weight_t > >
memberdef.definition: std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< weight_t > > cugraph::sorensen_all_pairs_coefficients
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, std::optional< edge_property_view_t< edge_t, weight_t const * > > edge_weight_view, std::optional< raft::device_span< vertex_t const > > vertices, std::optional< size_t > topk, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: sorensen_all_pairs_coefficients

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &

briefdescription.para: Compute Sorensen similarity coefficient.

detaileddescription.para: Similarity is computed for all pairs of vertices. Note that in a sparse graph, many of the vertex pairs will have a score of zero. We actually compute similarity only for vertices that are two hop neighbors within the graph, since vertices that are not two hop neighbors will have a score of 0.
If vertices is specified we will compute similarity on two hop neighbors the vertices. If vertices is not specified it will compute similarity on all two hop neighbors in the graph.
If topk is specified only the top topk scoring vertex pairs will be returned, if not specified then scores for all computed vertex pairs will be returned.

Note the list of two hop neighbors in the entire graph might be a large number of vertex pairs. If the graph is dense enough it could be as large as the the number of vertices squared, which might run out of memory.

parameterdescription.para: when an error occurs.
Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights. Needs to be a floating point type.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false)
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Graph view object.
Optional view object holding edge weights for graph_view. If edge_weight_view.has_value() == true, use the weights associated with the graph. If false, assume a weight of 1 for all edges.
optional device span defining the seed vertices.
optional specification of the how many of the top scoring vertex pairs should be returned
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

simplesect.para: tuple containing three device vectors (v1, v2, score) of the same length. Corresponding elements in the vectors identify a result, v1 identifying a vertex in the graph, v2 identifying one of v1's two hop neighors, and the score identifying the similarity score between v1 and v2. If topk was specified then the vectors will be no longer than topk elements. In a multi-gpu context, if topk is specified all results will return on GPU rank 0, otherwise they will be returned on the local GPU for vertex v1.

memberdef.definition: GraphViewType::edge_type cugraph::count_if_e
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, GraphViewType const &graph_view, EdgeSrcValueInputWrapper edge_src_value_input, EdgeDstValueInputWrapper edge_dst_value_input, EdgeValueInputWrapper edge_value_input, EdgeOp e_op, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: count_if_e

briefdescription.para: Count the number of edges that satisfies the given predicate.

detaileddescription.para: This function is inspired by thrust::count_if().

parameterdescription.para: Type of the passed non-owning graph object.
Type of the wrapper for edge source property values.
Type of the wrapper for edge destination property values.
Type of the wrapper for edge property values.
Type of the quinary edge operator.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Non-owning graph object.

Wrapper used to access source input property values (for the edge sources assigned to this process in multi-GPU). Use either cugraph::edge_src_property_t::view() (if e_op needs to access source property values) or cugraph::edge_src_dummy_property_t::view() (if e_op does not access source property values). Use update_edge_src_property to fill the wrapper.

Wrapper used to access destination input property values (for the edge destinations assigned to this process in multi-GPU). Use either cugraph::edge_dst_property_t::view() (if e_op needs to access destination property values) or cugraph::edge_dst_dummy_property_t::view() (if e_op does not access destination property values). Use update_edge_dst_property to fill the wrapper.

Wrapper used to access edge input property values (for the edges assigned to this process in multi-GPU). Use either cugraph::edge_property_t::view() (if e_op needs to access edge property values) or cugraph::edge_dummy_property_t::view() (if e_op does not access edge property values).
Quinary operator takes edge source, edge destination, property values for the source, destination, and edge and returns true if this edge should be included in the returned count.
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

simplesect.para: GraphViewType::edge_type Number of times e_op returned true.

memberdef.definition: GraphViewType::vertex_type cugraph::count_if_v
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, GraphViewType const &graph_view, VertexValueInputIterator vertex_value_input_first, VertexOp v_op, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: count_if_v

briefdescription.para: Count the number of vertices that satisfies the given predicate.

detaileddescription.para: This version iterates over the entire set of graph vertices. This function is inspired by thrust::count_if().

parameterdescription.para: Type of the passed non-owning graph object.
Type of the iterator for vertex property values.
Type of the unary predicate operator.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Non-owning graph object.

Iterator pointing to the vertex property values for the first (inclusive) vertex (assigned to this process in multi-GPU). vertex_value_input_last (exclusive) is deduced as vertex_value_input_first + graph_view.local_vertex_partition_range_size().

Binary operator takes vertex ID and *(vertex_value_input_first + i) (where i is [0, graph_view.local_vertex_partition_range_size())) and returns true if this vertex should be included in the returned count.
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

simplesect.para: GraphViewType::vertex_type Number of times v_op returned true.

memberdef.definition: decltype(allocate_dataframe_buffer< typename detail::edge_op_result_type< typename GraphViewType::vertex_type, typename GraphViewType::vertex_type, typename EdgeSrcValueInputWrapper::value_type, typename EdgeDstValueInputWrapper::value_type, typename EdgeValueInputWrapper::value_type, EdgeOp >::type::value_type >(size_t{0}, rmm::cuda_stream_view{})) cugraph::extract_transform_e

memberdef.name: extract_transform_e

briefdescription.para: Iterate over the entire set of edges and extract the valid edge functor outputs.

parameterdescription.para: Type of the passed non-owning graph object.
Type of the wrapper for edge source property values.
Type of the wrapper for edge destination property values.
Type of the wrapper for edge property values.
Type of the quinary edge operator.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Non-owning graph object.

Wrapper used to access source input property values (for the edge sources assigned to this process in multi-GPU). Use either cugraph::edge_src_property_t::view() (if e_op needs to access source property values) or cugraph::edge_src_dummy_property_t::view() (if e_op does not access source property values). Use update_edge_src_property to fill the wrapper.

Wrapper used to access destination input property values (for the edge destinations assigned to this process in multi-GPU). Use either cugraph::edge_dst_property_t::view() (if e_op needs to access destination property values) or cugraph::edge_dst_dummy_property_t::view() (if e_op does not access destination property values). Use update_edge_dst_property to fill the wrapper.

Wrapper used to access edge input property values (for the edges assigned to this process in multi-GPU). Use either cugraph::edge_property_t::view() (if e_op needs to access edge property values) or cugraph::edge_dummy_property_t::view() (if e_op does not access edge property values).

Quinary operator takes edge source, edge destination, property values for the source, property values for the destination, and property values for the edge and returns thrust::nullopt (if the return value is to be discarded) or a valid e_op output to be extracted and accumulated.
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

simplesect.para: Dataframe buffer object storing extracted and accumulated valid e_op return values.

memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, GraphViewType const &graph_view, EdgeValueInputIterator edge_value_input, VertexPairIterator vertex_pair_first, VertexPairIterator vertex_pair_last, VertexValueInputIterator vertex_value_input_first, IntersectionOp intersection_op, VertexPairValueOutputIterator vertex_pair_value_output_first, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: per_v_pair_transform_dst_nbr_intersection

briefdescription.para: Iterate over each input vertex pair and apply a functor to the common destination neighbor list of the pair.

detaileddescription.para: Iterate over every vertex pair; intersect destination neighbor lists of the two vertices in the pair; invoke a user-provided functor, and store the functor output.

parameterdescription.para: Type of the passed non-owning graph object.
Type of the iterator for input vertex pairs.
Type of the iterator for vertex property values.
Type of the iterator for edge property values.
Type of the quinary per intersection operator.
Type of the iterator for vertex pair output property variables.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Non-owning graph object.
Iterator pointing to the first (inclusive) input vertex pair.
Iterator pointing to the last (exclusive) input vertex pair.
Wrapper used to access vertex input property values (for the vertices assigned to this process in multi-GPU).

Wrapper used to access edge input property values (for the edges assigned to this process in multi-GPU). Use either cugraph::edge_property_t::view() (if intersection_op needs to access edge property values) or cugraph::edge_dummy_property_t::view() (if intersection_op does not access edge property values).

quinary operator takes first vertex of the pair, second vertex of the pair, property values for the first vertex, property values for the second vertex, and a list of vertices in the intersection of the first & second vertices' destination neighbors and returns an output value for the input pair.

Iterator pointing to the vertex pair property variables for the first vertex pair (inclusive). vertex_pair_value_output_last (exclusive) is deduced as vertex_pair_value_output_first + thrust::distance(vertex_pair_first, vertex_pair_last).
flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

memberdef.type: std::tuple< std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< size_t > >, decltype(allocate_dataframe_buffer< T >(size_t{0}, rmm::cuda_stream_view{}))>
memberdef.definition: std::tuple< std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< size_t > >, decltype(allocate_dataframe_buffer< T >(size_t{0}, rmm::cuda_stream_view{}))> cugraph::per_v_random_select_transform_outgoing_e
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, GraphViewType const &graph_view, VertexFrontierBucketType const &frontier, EdgeSrcValueInputWrapper edge_src_value_input, EdgeDstValueInputWrapper edge_dst_value_input, EdgeValueInputWrapper edge_value_input, EdgeBiasOp e_bias_op, EdgeOp e_op, raft::random::RngState &rng_state, size_t K, bool with_replacement, std::optional< T > invalid_value, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: per_v_random_select_transform_outgoing_e

briefdescription.para: Randomly select and transform the input (tagged-)vertices' outgoing edges with biases.

parameterdescription.para: Type of the passed non-owning graph object.
Type of the vertex frontier bucket class which abstracts the current (tagged-)vertex frontier.
Type of the wrapper for edge source property values.
Type of the wrapper for edge destination property values.
Type of the wrapper for edge property values.
Type of the quinary edge operator to set-up selection bias values.
Type of the quinary edge operator.
Type of the selected and transformed edge output values.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Non-owning graph object.
VertexFrontierBucketType class object to store the (tagged-)vertex list to sample outgoing edges.

Wrapper used to access source input property values (for the edge sources assigned to this process in multi-GPU). Use either cugraph::edge_src_property_t::view() (if e_op needs to access source property values) or cugraph::edge_src_dummy_property_t::view() (if e_op does not access source property values). Use update_edge_src_property to fill the wrapper.

Wrapper used to access destination input property values (for the edge destinations assigned to this process in multi-GPU). Use either cugraph::edge_dst_property_t::view() (if e_op needs to access destination property values) or cugraph::edge_dst_dummy_property_t::view() (if e_op does not access destination property values). Use update_edge_dst_property to fill the wrapper.

Wrapper used to access edge input property values (for the edges assigned to this process in multi-GPU). Use either cugraph::edge_property_t::view() (if e_op needs to access edge property values) or cugraph::edge_dummy_property_t::view() (if e_op does not access edge property values).

Quinary operator takes (tagged-)edge source, edge destination, property values for the source, destination, and edge and returns a floating point bias value to be used in biased random selection. The return value should be non-negative. The bias value of 0 indicates that the corresponding edge cannot be selected. Assuming that the return value type is bias_t, the sum of the bias values for any seed vertex should not exceed std::numeric_limits<bias_t>::max().

Quinary operator takes (tagged-)edge source, edge destination, property values for the source, destination, and edge and returns a value to be collected in the output. This function is called only for the selected edges.
Number of outgoing edges to select per (tagged-)vertex.
A flag to specify whether a single outgoing edge can be selected multiple times (if with_replacement = true) or can be selected only once (if with_replacement = false).

If invalid_value.has_value() is true, this value is used to fill the output vector for the zero out-degree vertices (if with_replacement = true) or the vertices with their out-degrees smaller than K (if with_replacement = false). If invalid_value.has_value() is false, fewer than K values can be returned for the vertices with fewer than K selected edges. See the return value section for additional details.
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

simplesect.para: std::tuple Tuple of an optional offset vector of type std::optional<rmm::device_uvector<size_t>> and a dataframe buffer storing the output values of type T from the selected edges. If invalid_value is std::nullopt, the offset vector is valid and has the size of frontier.size() + 1. If invalid_value.has_value() is true, std::nullopt is returned (the dataframe buffer will store frontier.size() * K elements).

memberdef.type: std::tuple< std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< size_t > >, decltype(allocate_dataframe_buffer< T >(size_t{0}, rmm::cuda_stream_view{}))>
memberdef.definition: std::tuple< std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< size_t > >, decltype(allocate_dataframe_buffer< T >(size_t{0}, rmm::cuda_stream_view{}))> cugraph::per_v_random_select_transform_outgoing_e
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, GraphViewType const &graph_view, VertexFrontierBucketType const &frontier, EdgeSrcValueInputWrapper edge_src_value_input, EdgeDstValueInputWrapper edge_dst_value_input, EdgeValueInputWrapper edge_value_input, EdgeOp e_op, raft::random::RngState &rng_state, size_t K, bool with_replacement, std::optional< T > invalid_value, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: per_v_random_select_transform_outgoing_e

briefdescription.para: Randomly select and transform the input (tagged-)vertices' outgoing edges.

detaileddescription.para: This function assumes that every outgoing edge of a given vertex has the same odd to be selected (uniform neighbor sampling).

parameterdescription.para: Type of the passed non-owning graph object.
Type of the vertex frontier bucket class which abstracts the current (tagged-)vertex frontier.
Type of the wrapper for edge source property values.
Type of the wrapper for edge destination property values.
Type of the wrapper for edge property values.
Type of the quinary edge operator.
Type of the selected and transformed edge output values.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Non-owning graph object.
VertexFrontierBucketType class object to store the (tagged-)vertex list to sample outgoing edges.

Wrapper used to access source input property values (for the edge sources assigned to this process in multi-GPU). Use either cugraph::edge_src_property_t::view() (if e_op needs to access source property values) or cugraph::edge_src_dummy_property_t::view() (if e_op does not access source property values). Use update_edge_src_property to fill the wrapper.

Wrapper used to access destination input property values (for the edge destinations assigned to this process in multi-GPU). Use either cugraph::edge_dst_property_t::view() (if e_op needs to access destination property values) or cugraph::edge_dst_dummy_property_t::view() (if e_op does not access destination property values). Use update_edge_dst_property to fill the wrapper.

Wrapper used to access edge input property values (for the edges assigned to this process in multi-GPU). Use either cugraph::edge_property_t::view() (if e_op needs to access edge property values) or cugraph::edge_dummy_property_t::view() (if e_op does not access edge property values).

Quinary operator takes (tagged-)edge source, edge destination, property values for the source, destination, and edge and returns a value to be collected in the output. This function is called only for the selected edges.
Number of outgoing edges to select per (tagged-)vertex.
A flag to specify whether a single outgoing edge can be selected multiple times (if with_replacement = true) or can be selected only once (if with_replacement = false).

If invalid_value.has_value() is true, this value is used to fill the output vector for the zero out-degree vertices (if with_replacement = true) or the vertices with their out-degrees smaller than K (if with_replacement = false). If invalid_value.has_value() is false, fewer than K values can be returned for the vertices with fewer than K selected edges. See the return value section for additional details.
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

simplesect.para: std::tuple Tuple of an optional offset vector of type std::optional<rmm::device_uvector<size_t>> and a dataframe buffer storing the output values of type T from the selected edges. If invalid_value is std::nullopt, the offset vector is valid and has the size of frontier.size() + 1. If invalid_value.has_value() is true, std::nullopt is returned (the dataframe buffer will store frontier.size() * K elements).

memberdef.definition: void cugraph::per_v_transform_reduce_dst_key_aggregated_outgoing_e
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, GraphViewType const &graph_view, EdgeSrcValueInputWrapper edge_src_value_input, EdgeValueInputWrapper edge_value_input, EdgeDstKeyInputWrapper edge_dst_key_input, KVStoreViewType kv_store_view, KeyAggregatedEdgeOp key_aggregated_e_op, T init, ReduceOp reduce_op, VertexValueOutputIterator vertex_value_output_first, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: per_v_transform_reduce_dst_key_aggregated_outgoing_e

briefdescription.para: Iterate over every vertex's destination key-aggregated outgoing edges to update vertex property values.

detaileddescription.para: This function is inspired by thrust::transform_reduce(). Unlike per_v_transform_reduce_outgoing_e, this function first aggregates outgoing edges by destination keys to support two level reduction for every vertex.

parameterdescription.para: Type of the passed non-owning graph object.
Type of the wrapper for edge source property values.
Type of the wrapper for edge property values.
Type of the wrapper for edge destination key values.
Type of the (key, value) store. Key type should coincide with vertex type.
Type of the quinary key-aggregated edge operator.
Type of the binary reduction operator.
Type of the initial value for per-vertex reduction.
Type of the iterator for vertex output property variables.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Non-owning graph object.

Wrapper used to access source input property values (for the edge sources assigned to this process in multi-GPU). Use either cugraph::edge_src_property_t::view() (if e_op needs to access source property values) or cugraph::edge_src_dummy_property_t::view() (if e_op does not access source property values). Use update_edge_src_property to fill the wrapper.

Wrapper used to access edge input property values (for the edges assigned to this process in multi-GPU). Use either cugraph::edge_property_t::view() (if e_op needs to access edge property values) or cugraph::edge_dummy_property_t::view() (if e_op does not access edge property values).

Wrapper used to access destination input key values (for the edge destinations assigned to this process in multi-GPU). Use cugraph::edge_dst_property_t::view(). Use update_edge_dst_property to fill the wrapper.

view object of the (key, value) store (for the keys assigned to this process in multi-GPU). cugraph::detail::compute_gpu_id_from_ext_vertex_t is used to map keys to processes). (Key, value) pairs may be provided by transform_reduce_e_by_src_key() or transform_reduce_e_by_dst_key().

Quinary operator takes 1) edge source, 2) key, 3) *(edge_partition_src_value_input_first + i), 4) value for the key stored in the input (key, value) pairs provided by map_unique_key_first, map_unique_key_last, and map_value_first (aggregated over the entire set of processes in multi-GPU), and 5) aggregated edge value.
Initial value to be reduced with the reduced value for each vertex.

Binary operator that takes two input arguments and reduce the two values to one. There are pre-defined reduction operators in src/prims/reduce_op.cuh. It is recommended to use the pre-defined reduction operators whenever possible as the current (and future) implementations of graph primitives may check whether ReduceOp is a known type (or has known member variables) to take a more optimized code path. See the documentation in the reduce_op.cuh file for instructions on writing custom reduction operators.

Iterator pointing to the vertex property variables for the first (inclusive) vertex (assigned to this process in multi-GPU). vertex_value_output_last (exclusive) is deduced as vertex_value_output_first + graph_view.local_vertex_partition_range_size().
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

briefdescription.para: Reduce the input vertex property values.

detaileddescription.para: This function is inspired by thrust::reduce().

See the documentation in the reduce_op.cuh file for instructions on writing custom reduction operators.
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

memberdef.definition: void cugraph::transform_reduce_dst_nbr_intersection_of_e_endpoints_by_v
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, GraphViewType const &graph_view, EdgeSrcValueInputWrapper edge_src_value_input, EdgeDstValueInputWrapper edge_dst_value_input, IntersectionOp intersection_op, T init, VertexValueOutputIterator vertex_value_output_first, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: transform_reduce_dst_nbr_intersection_of_e_endpoints_by_v

briefdescription.para: Iterate over each edge and apply a functor to the common destination neighbor list of the edge endpoints, reduce the functor output values per-vertex.

detaileddescription.para: Iterate over every edge; intersect destination neighbor lists of source vertex & destination vertex; invoke a user-provided functor per intersection, and reduce the functor output values (thrust::tuple of three values having the same type: one for source, one for destination, and one for every vertex in the intersection) per-vertex. We may add transform_reduce_triplet_of_dst_nbr_intersection_of_e_endpoints_by_v in the future to allow emitting different values for different vertices in the intersection of edge endpoints. This function is inspired by thrust::transform_reduce().

parameterdescription.para: Type of the passed non-owning graph object.
Type of the wrapper for edge source property values.
Type of the wrapper for edge destination property values.
Type of the quinary per intersection operator.
Type of the initial value for per-vertex reduction.
Type of the iterator for vertex output property variables.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Non-owning graph object.

Wrapper used to access source input property values (for the edge sources assigned to this process in multi-GPU). Use either cugraph::edge_src_property_t::view() (if intersection_op needs to access source property values) or cugraph::edge_src_dummy_property_t::view() (if intersection_op does not access source property values). Use update_edge_src_property to fill the wrapper.

Wrapper used to access destination input property values (for the edge destinations assigned to this process in multi-GPU). Use either cugraph::edge_dst_property_t::view() (if intersection_op needs to access destination property values) or cugraph::edge_dst_dummy_property_t::view() (if intersection_op does not access destination property values). Use update_edge_dst_property to fill the wrapper.

quinary operator takes edge source, edge destination, property values for the source, property values for the destination, and a list of vertices in the intersection of edge source & destination vertices' destination neighbors and returns a thrust::tuple of three values: one value per source vertex, one value for destination vertex, and one value for every vertex in the intersection.
Initial value to be added to the reduced intersection_op return values for each vertex.

Iterator pointing to the vertex property variables for the first (inclusive) vertex (assigned to this process in multi-GPU). vertex_value_output_last (exclusive) is deduced as vertex_value_output_first + graph_view.local_vertex_partition_range_size().
flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

Wrapper used to access destination input property values (for the edge destinations assigned to this process in multi-GPU). Use either cugraph::edge_dst_property_t::view() (if e_op needs to access destination property values) or cugraph::edge_dst_dummy_property_t::view() (if e_op does not access destination property values). Use update_edge_dst_property to fill the wrapper.

Wrapper used to access edge input property values (for the edges assigned to this process in multi-GPU). Use either cugraph::edge_property_t::view() (if e_op needs to access edge property values) or cugraph::edge_dummy_property_t::view() (if e_op does not access edge property values).
Quinary operator takes edge source, edge destination, property values for the source, destination, and edge and returns a value to be reduced.
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

simplesect.para: Transform-reduced edge_op outputs.

briefdescription.para: Iterate over the entire set of edges and reduce edge_op outputs to (key, value) pairs.

detaileddescription.para: This function is inspired by thrust::transform_reduce() and thrust::reduce_by_key(). Keys for edges are determined by the edge sources.

parameterdescription.para: Type of the passed non-owning graph object.
Type of the wrapper for edge source property values.
Type of the wrapper for edge destination property values.
Type of the wrapper for edge source key values.
Type of the wrapper for edge property values.
Type of the quinary edge operator.
Type of the values in (key, value) pairs.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Non-owning graph object.

Wrapper used to access source input property values (for the edge sources assigned to this process in multi-GPU). Use either cugraph::edge_src_property_t::view() (if e_op needs to access source property values) or cugraph::edge_src_dummy_property_t::view() (if e_op does not access source property values). Use update_edge_src_property to fill the wrapper.

Wrapper used to access destination input property values (for the edge destinations assigned to this process in multi-GPU). Use either cugraph::edge_dst_property_t::view() (if e_op needs to access destination property values) or cugraph::edge_dst_dummy_property_t::view() (if e_op does not access destination property values). Use update_edge_dst_property to fill the wrapper.
Wrapper used to access source input ke values (for the edge sources assigned to this process in multi-GPU). Use cugraph::edge_src_property_t::view(). Use update_edge_src_property to fill the wrapper.

Wrapper used to access edge input property values (for the edges assigned to this process in multi-GPU). Use either cugraph::edge_property_t::view() (if e_op needs to access edge property values) or cugraph::edge_dummy_property_t::view() (if e_op does not access edge property values).
Quinary operator takes edge source, edge destination, property values for the source, destination, and edge and returns a value to be reduced to (source key, value) pairs.
Initial value to be added to the value in each transform-reduced (source key, value) pair.

Binary operator that takes two input arguments and reduce the two values to one. There are pre-defined reduction operators in src/prims/reduce_op.cuh. It is recommended to use the pre-defined reduction operators whenever possible as the current (and future) implementations of graph primitives may check whether ReduceOp is a known type (or has known member variables) to take a more optimized code path. See the documentation in the reduce_op.cuh file for instructions on writing custom reduction operators.

briefdescription.para: Reduce the transformed input vertex property values.

detaileddescription.para: This function is inspired by thrust::transform_reduce().

parameterdescription.para: Type of the passed non-owning graph object.
Type of the binary reduction operator.
Type of the iterator for vertex property values.
Type of the unary vertex operator.
Type of the initial value.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Non-owning graph object.

Iterator pointing to the vertex property values for the first (inclusive) vertex (assigned to this process in multi-GPU). vertex_value_input_last (exclusive) is deduced as vertex_value_input_first + graph_view.local_vertex_partition_range_size().
Binary operator takes vertex ID and *(vertex_value_input_first + i) (where i is [0, graph_view.local_vertex_partition_range_size())) and returns a transformed value to be reduced.
Initial value to be reduced with the transform-reduced input vertex property values.

Binary operator that takes two input arguments and reduce the two values to one. There are pre-defined reduction operators in include/cugraph/prims/reduce_op.cuh. See the documentation in the reduce_op.cuh file for instructions on writing custom reduction operators.
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

simplesect.para: T Transformed and reduced input vertex property values.

memberdef.definition: void cugraph::update_v_frontier
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, GraphViewType const &graph_view, KeyBuffer &&key_buffer, PayloadBuffer &&payload_buffer, VertexFrontierType &frontier, std::vector< size_t > const &next_frontier_bucket_indices, VertexValueInputIterator vertex_value_input_first, VertexValueOutputIterator vertex_value_output_first, VertexOp v_op, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: update_v_frontier

briefdescription.para: Insert (tagged-)vertices to the vertex frontier and update vertex property values of the newly inserted vertices .

detaileddescription.para: This primitive often works in pair with transform_reduce_v_frontier_outgoing_e_by_dst. This version of update_v_frontier takes payload_buffer and @v_op takes a payload value in addition to a (tagged-)vertex and a vertex property value as input arguments.

parameterdescription.para: Type of the passed non-owning graph object.
Type of the buffer storing (tagged-)vertices.
Type of the buffer storing payload values.
Type of the vertex frontier class which abstracts vertex frontier managements.
Type of the iterator for input vertex property values.
Type of the iterator for output vertex property variables.
Type of the ternary vertex operator.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Non-owning graph object.
buffer object storing (tagged-)vertices to insert.
buffer object storing payload values for each (tagged-)vertices in the key_buffer.
VertexFrontierType class object for vertex frontier managements. This object includes multiple bucket objects.
Indices of the vertex frontier buckets to store new frontier (tagged-)vertices.

Iterator pointing to the vertex property values for the first (inclusive) vertex (assigned to this process in multi-GPU). vertex_value_input_last (exclusive) is deduced as vertex_value_input_first + graph_view.local_vertex_partition_range_size().

Iterator pointing to the vertex property variables for the first (inclusive) vertex (assigned to this process in multi-GPU). vertex_value_output_last (exclusive) is deduced as vertex_value_output_first + graph_view.local_vertex_partition_range_size().

Ternary operator that takes (tagged-)vertex ID, *(vertex_value_input_first + i) (where i is [0, graph_view.local_vertex_partition_range_size())) and the payload value for the (tagged-)vertex ID and returns a tuple of 1) a thrust::optional object optionally storing a bucket index and 2) a thrust::optional object optionally storing a new vertex property value. If the first element of the returned tuple is thrust::nullopt, this (tagged-)vertex won't be inserted to the vertex frontier. If the second element is thrust::nullopt, the vertex property value for this vertex won't be updated. Note that it is currently undefined behavior if there are multiple tagged-vertices with the same vertex ID (but with different tags) AND v_op results on the tagged-vertices with the same vertex ID have more than one valid new vertex property values.

memberdef.definition: void cugraph::update_v_frontier
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, GraphViewType const &graph_view, KeyBuffer &&key_buffer, VertexFrontierType &frontier, std::vector< size_t > const &next_frontier_bucket_indices, VertexValueInputIterator vertex_value_input_first, VertexValueOutputIterator vertex_value_output_first, VertexOp v_op, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: update_v_frontier

briefdescription.para: Insert (tagged-)vertices to the vertex frontier and update vertex property values of the newly inserted vertices .

detaileddescription.para: This primitive often works in pair with transform_reduce_v_frontier_outgoing_e_by_dst. This version of update_v_frontier does not take payload_buffer and @v_op takes a (tagged-)vertex and a vertex property value as input arguments (no payload value in the input parameter list).

parameterdescription.para: Type of the passed non-owning graph object.
Type of the buffer storing (tagged-)vertices.
Type of the vertex frontier class which abstracts vertex frontier managements.
Type of the iterator for input vertex property values.
Type of the iterator for output vertex property variables.
Type of the binary vertex operator.

Non-owning graph object.
buffer object storing (tagged-)vertices to insert.

Indices of the vertex frontier buckets to store new frontier (tagged-)vertices.

Iterator pointing to the vertex property values for the first (inclusive) vertex (assigned to this process in multi-GPU). vertex_value_input_last (exclusive) is deduced as vertex_value_input_first + graph_view.local_vertex_partition_range_size().

Iterator pointing to the vertex property variables for the first (inclusive) vertex (assigned to this process in multi-GPU). vertex_value_output_last (exclusive) is deduced as vertex_value_output_first + graph_view.local_vertex_partition_range_size().

Binary operator that takes (tagged-)vertex ID, and *(vertex_value_input_first + i) (where i is [0, graph_view.local_vertex_partition_range_size())) and returns a tuple of 1) a thrust::optional object optionally storing a bucket index and 2) a thrust::optional object optionally storing a new vertex property value. If the first element of the returned tuple is thrust::nullopt, this (tagged-)vertex won't be inserted to the vertex frontier. If the second element is thrust::nullopt, the vertex property value for this vertex won't be updated. Note that it is currently undefined behavior if there are multiple tagged-vertices with the same vertex ID (but with different tags) AND v_op results on the tagged-vertices with the same vertex ID have more than one valid new vertex property values.

= number(vertices) to use for sub-sampling.
= max number of neighbors per output vertex.
= the sampling algorithm (algo R/algo L/etc.) used to produce outputs.

memberdef.name: random_walks

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &

briefdescription.para: returns random walks (RW) from starting sources, where each path is of given maximum length. Uniform distribution is assumed for the random engine.

parameterdescription.para: Type of graph/view (typically, graph_view_t).
Type used to store indexing and sizes.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Graph (view )object to generate RW on.
Device pointer to set of starting vertex indices for the RW.
= number(paths).
maximum length of RWs.

(optional) specifies if return uses padded format (true), or coalesced (compressed) format; when padding is used the output is a matrix of vertex paths and a matrix of edges paths (weights); in this case the matrices are stored in row major order; the vertex path matrix is padded with num_vertices values and the weight matrix is padded with 0 values;
identifier for sampling strategy: uniform, biased, etc.; defaults to uniform = 0;

simplesect.para: std::tuple<rmm::device_uvector<vertex_t>, rmm::device_uvector<weight_t>, rmm::device_uvector<index_t>> Triplet of either padded or coalesced RW paths; in the coalesced case (default), the return consists of corresponding vertex and edge weights for each, and corresponding path sizes. This is meant to minimize the number of DF's to be passed to the Python layer. The meaning of "coalesced" here is that a 2D array of paths of different sizes is represented as a 1D contiguous array. In the padded case the return is a matrix of num_paths x max_depth vertex paths; and num_paths x (max_depth-1) edge (weight) paths, with an empty array of sizes. Note: if the graph is un-weighted the edge (weight) paths consists of weight_t{1} entries;

xrefdescription.para: This algorithm will be deprecated once all of the functionality is migrated to the newer APIS: uniform_random_walks(), biased_random_walks(), and node2vec_random_walks().

parameterdescription.para: Type of graph/view (typically, graph_view_t).
Type used to store indexing and sizes.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Graph (view )object to generate RW on.
Device pointer to set of starting vertex indices for the RW.
= number(paths).
maximum length of RWs.

(optional) specifies if return uses padded format (true), or coalesced (compressed) format; when padding is used the output is a matrix of vertex paths and a matrix of edges paths (weights); in this case the matrices are stored in row major order; the vertex path matrix is padded with num_vertices values and the weight matrix is padded with 0 values;
pointer for sampling strategy: uniform, biased, etc.; possible values{0==uniform, 1==biased, 2==node2vec}; defaults to nullptr == uniform;

simplesect.para: std::tuple<rmm::device_uvector<vertex_t>, rmm::device_uvector<weight_t>, rmm::device_uvector<index_t>> Triplet of either padded or coalesced RW paths; in the coalesced case (default), the return consists of corresponding vertex and edge weights for each, and corresponding path sizes. This is meant to minimize the number of DF's to be passed to the Python layer. The meaning of "coalesced" here is that a 2D array of paths of different sizes is represented as a 1D contiguous array. In the padded case the return is a matrix of num_paths x max_depth vertex paths; and num_paths x (max_depth-1) edge (weight) paths, with an empty array of sizes. Note: if the graph is un-weighted the edge (weight) paths consists of weight_t{1} entries;

memberdef.type: std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< index_t > >
memberdef.definition: std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< index_t > > cugraph::convert_paths_to_coo
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, index_t coalesced_sz_v, index_t num_paths, rmm::device_buffer &&d_coalesced_v, rmm::device_buffer &&d_sizes)
memberdef.name: convert_paths_to_coo

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex indices.
Type used to store indexing and sizes.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
coalesced vertex vector size.
number of paths.
coalesced vertex buffer.
paths size buffer.

simplesect.para: tuple of (src_vertex_vector, dst_Vertex_vector, path_offsets), where path_offsets are the offsets where the COO set of each path starts.

parameterdescription.para: Type used to store indexing and sizes.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
number of paths.
sizes of vertex paths.

memberdef.definition: std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< weight_t > > > cugraph::uniform_random_walks
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, std::optional< edge_property_view_t< edge_t, weight_t const * > > edge_weight_view, raft::device_span< vertex_t const > start_vertices, size_t max_length, uint64_t seed=std::numeric_limits< uint64_t >::max())
memberdef.name: uniform_random_walks

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &

briefdescription.para: returns uniform random walks from starting sources, where each path is of given maximum length.

detaileddescription.para: start_vertices can contain duplicates, in which case different random walks will be generated for each instance.
If edge_weight_view.has_value() is true, the return contains edge weights. If edge_weight_view.has_value() is false, the returned value will be std::nullopt.

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights. Needs to be a floating point type.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false)
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
graph view to operate on
Optional view object holding edge weights for graph_view.
Device span defining the starting vertices
maximum length of random walk
(optional, defaults to system time), seed for random number generation

simplesect.para: tuple containing device vectors of vertices and the edge weights (if edge_weight_view.has_value() is true) For each input selector there will be (max_length+1) elements in the vertex vector with the starting vertex followed by the subsequent vertices in the random walk. If a path terminates before max_length, the vertices will be populated with invalid_vertex_id (-1 for signed vertex_t, std::numeric_limits<vertex_t>::max() for an unsigned vertex_t type) For each input selector there will be max_length elements in the weights vector with the edge weight for the edge in the path. If a path terminates before max_length the subsequent edge weights will be set to weight_t{0}.

memberdef.type: std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< weight_t > > >
memberdef.definition: std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< weight_t > > > cugraph::biased_random_walks
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, edge_property_view_t< edge_t, weight_t const * > edge_weight_view, raft::device_span< vertex_t const > start_vertices, size_t max_length, uint64_t seed=std::numeric_limits< uint64_t >::max())
memberdef.name: biased_random_walks

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &

briefdescription.para: returns biased random walks from starting sources, where each path is of given maximum length.

detaileddescription.para: The next vertex is biased based on the edge weights. The probability of traversing a departing edge will be the edge weight divided by the sum of the departing edge weights.
start_vertices can contain duplicates, in which case different random walks will be generated for each instance.

parameterdescription.para: if the graph is unweighted
Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights. Needs to be a floating point type.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false)
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
graph view to operate on
View object holding edge weights for graph_view.
Device span defining the starting vertices
maximum length of random walk
(optional, defaults to system time), seed for random number generation

simplesect.para: tuple containing device vectors of vertices and the edge weights For each input selector there will be (max_length+1) elements in the vertex vector with the starting vertex followed by the subsequent vertices in the random walk. If a path terminates before max_length, the vertices will be populated with invalid_vertex_id (-1 for signed vertex_t, std::numeric_limits<vertex_t>::max() for an unsigned vertex_t type) For each input selector there will be max_length elements in the weights vector with the edge weight for the edge in the path. If a path terminates before max_length the subsequent edge weights will be set to weight_t{0}.

memberdef.type: std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< weight_t > > >
memberdef.definition: std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< weight_t > > > cugraph::node2vec_random_walks
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, std::optional< edge_property_view_t< edge_t, weight_t const * > > edge_weight_view, raft::device_span< vertex_t const > start_vertices, size_t max_length, weight_t p, weight_t q, uint64_t seed=std::numeric_limits< uint64_t >::max())
memberdef.name: node2vec_random_walks

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &

briefdescription.para: returns biased random walks with node2vec biases from starting sources, where each path is of given maximum length.

detaileddescription.para: start_vertices can contain duplicates, in which case different random walks will be generated for each instance.

If the edge_weight_view.has_value() = true, the return contains edge weights and the node2vec computation will utilize the edge weights. If edge_weight_view.has_value() == false, then the return will not contain edge weights and the node2vec computation will assume an edge weight of 1 for all edges.

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights. Needs to be a floating point type.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false)
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
graph view to operate on
Optional view object holding edge weights for graph_view. If edge_weight_view.has_value() == false, edge weights are assumed to be 1.0.
Device span defining the starting vertices
maximum length of random walk
node2vec return parameter
node2vec in-out parameter
(optional, defaults to system time), seed for random number generation

simplesect.para: tuple containing device vectors of vertices and the edge weights For each input selector there will be (max_length+1) elements in the vertex vector with the starting vertex followed by the subsequent vertices in the random walk. If a path terminates before max_length, the vertices will be populated with invalid_vertex_id (-1 for signed vertex_t, std::numeric_limits<vertex_t>::max() for an unsigned vertex_t type) For each input selector there will be max_length elements in the weights vector with the edge weight for the edge in the path. If a path terminates before max_length the subsequent edge weights will be set to weight_t{0}.

memberdef.type: std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< size_t > > >
memberdef.definition: std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< size_t > > > cugraph::renumber_sampled_edgelist
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > &&edgelist_srcs, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > &&edgelist_dsts, std::optional< raft::device_span< int32_t const > > edgelist_hops, std::optional< std::tuple< raft::device_span< label_t const >, raft::device_span< size_t const > > > label_offsets, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: renumber_sampled_edgelist

param.type: std::optional< std::tuple< raft::device_span< label_t const >, raft::device_span< size_t const > > >

briefdescription.para: renumber sampling output

xrefdescription.para: This API will be deprecated and will be replaced by the renumber_and_compress_sampled_edgelist and renumber_and_sort_sampled_edgelist functions in sampling_functions.hpp.

detaileddescription.para: This function renumbers sampling function (e.g. uniform_neighbor_sample) outputs satisfying the following requirements.

listitem.para: If edgelist_hops is valid, we can consider (vertex ID, flag=src, hop) triplets for each vertex ID in edgelist_srcs and (vertex ID, flag=dst, hop) triplets for each vertex ID in edgelist_dsts. From these triplets, we can find the minimum (hop, flag) pairs for every unique vertex ID (hop is the primary key and flag is the secondary key, flag=src is considered smaller than flag=dst if hop numbers are same). Vertex IDs with smaller (hop, flag) pairs precede vertex IDs with larger (hop, flag) pairs in renumbering. Ordering can be arbitrary among the vertices with the same (hop, flag) pairs.
If edgelist_hops is invalid, unique vertex IDs in edgelist_srcs precede vertex IDs that appear only in edgelist_dsts.
If label_offsets.has_value() is ture, edge lists for different labels will be renumbered separately.

detaileddescription.para: This function is single-GPU only (we are not aware of any practical multi-GPU use cases).

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of labels. Needs to be an integral type.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
A vector storing original edgelist source vertices.
A vector storing original edgelist destination vertices (size = edgelist_srcs.size()).
An optional pointer to the array storing hops for each edge list (source, destination) pairs (size = edgelist_srcs.size() if valid).
An optional tuple of unique labels and the input edge list (edgelist_srcs, edgelist_hops, and edgelist_dsts) offsets for the labels (siez = # unique labels + 1).
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

simplesect.para: Tuple of vectors storing renumbered edge sources (size = edgelist_srcs.size()) , renumbered edge destinations (size = edgelist_dsts.size()), renumber_map to query original verties (size = # unique vertices or aggregate # unique vertices for every label), and renumber_map offsets (size = std::get<0>(*label_offsets).size() + 1, valid only if label_offsets.has_value() is true).

memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, std::optional< edge_property_view_t< edge_t, weight_t const * > > edge_weight_view, std::optional< edge_property_view_t< edge_t, edge_t const * > > edge_id_view, std::optional< edge_property_view_t< edge_t, edge_type_t const * > > edge_type_view, raft::device_span< vertex_t const > starting_vertices, std::optional< raft::device_span< label_t const > > starting_vertex_labels, std::optional< std::tuple< raft::device_span< label_t const >, raft::device_span< int32_t const > > > label_to_output_comm_rank, raft::host_span< int32_t const > fan_out, raft::random::RngState &rng_state, bool return_hops, bool with_replacement=true, prior_sources_behavior_t prior_sources_behavior=prior_sources_behavior_t::DEFAULT, bool dedupe_sources=false, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: uniform_neighbor_sample

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu > const &
std::optional< std::tuple< raft::device_span< label_t const >, raft::device_span< int32_t const > > >

briefdescription.para: Uniform Neighborhood Sampling.

detaileddescription.para: This function traverses from a set of starting vertices, traversing outgoing edges and randomly selects from these outgoing neighbors to extract a subgraph.

Output from this function is a tuple of vectors (src, dst, weight, edge_id, edge_type, hop, label, offsets), identifying the randomly selected edges. src is the source vertex, dst is the destination vertex, weight (optional) is the edge weight, edge_id (optional) identifies the edge id, edge_type (optional) identifies the edge type, hop identifies which hop the edge was encountered in. The label output (optional) identifes the vertex label. The offsets array (optional) will be described below and is dependent upon the input parameters.
If starting_vertex_labels is not specified then no organization is applied to the output, the label and offsets values in the return set will be std::nullopt.

If starting_vertex_labels is specified and label_to_output_comm_rank is not specified then the label output has values. This will also result in the output being sorted by vertex label. The offsets array in the return will be a CSR-style offsets array to identify the beginning of each label range in the data. labels.size() == (offsets.size() - 1).

If starting_vertex_labels is specified and label_to_output_comm_rank is specified then the label output has values. This will also result in the output being sorted by vertex label. The offsets array in the return will be a CSR-style offsets array to identify the beginning of each label range in the data. labels.size() == (offsets.size() - 1). Additionally, the data will be shuffled so that all data with a particular label will be on the specified rank.

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights. Needs to be a floating point type.
Type of edge type. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of label. Needs to be an integral type.
Flag indicating whether sources (if false) or destinations (if true) are major indices
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false)
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Graph View object to generate NBR Sampling on.
Optional view object holding edge weights for graph_view.
Optional view object holding edge ids for graph_view.
Optional view object holding edge types for graph_view.
Device span of starting vertex IDs for the sampling. In a multi-gpu context the starting vertices should be local to this GPU.
Optional device span of labels associted with each starting vertex for the sampling.

Optional tuple of device spans mapping label to a particular output rank. Element 0 of the tuple identifes the label, Element 1 of the tuple identifies the output rank. The label span must be sorted in ascending order.
Host span defining branching out (fan-out) degree per source vertex for each level
A pre-initialized raft::RngState object for generating random numbers
boolean flag specifying if the hop information should be returned
Enum type defining how to handle prior sources, (defaults to DEFAULT)

boolean flag, if true then if a vertex v appears as a destination in hop X multiple times with the same label, it will only be passed once (for each label) as a source for the next hop. Default is false.
boolean flag specifying if random sampling is done with replacement (true); or, without replacement (false); default = true;
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

simplesect.para: tuple device vectors (vertex_t source_vertex, vertex_t destination_vertex, optional weight_t weight, optional edge_t edge id, optional edge_type_t edge type, optional int32_t hop, optional label_t label, optional size_t offsets)

memberdef.type: std::tuple< graph_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu >, std::optional< edge_property_t< graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu >, weight_t > >, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > > >
memberdef.definition: std::tuple< graph_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu >, std::optional< edge_property_t< graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu >, weight_t > >, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > > > cugraph::coarsen_graph
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, std::optional< edge_property_view_t< edge_t, weight_t const * > > edge_weight_view, vertex_t const *labels, bool renumber, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: coarsen_graph

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu > const &

briefdescription.para: Compute the coarsened graph.

detaileddescription.para: Aggregates the vertices with the same label to a new vertex in the output coarsened graph. Multi-edges in the coarsened graph are collapsed to a single edge with its weight equal to the sum of multi-edge weights.

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights. Needs to be a floating point type.
Flag indicating whether to use sources (if false) or destinations (if true) as major indices in storing edges using a 2D sparse matrix. transposed.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false) or multi-GPU (true).
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Graph view object of the input graph to be coarsened.
Optional view object holding edge weights for graph_view.
Vertex labels (assigned to this process in multi-GPU) to be used in coarsening.

Flag indicating whether to renumber vertices or not (must be true if multi_gpu is true). Setting renumber to false is highly discouraged except for testing as this negatively affects the performance and memory footprint. If renumber is set to true, labels should have only non-negative integers and the number of vertices is assumed to be the maximum element in labels (reduced over the entire set of GPUs in multi-GPU) + 1. This may produce many isolated vertices if the number of unique elements (over the entire set of GPUs in multi-GPU) in labels is much smaller than the assumed number of vertices.
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

simplesect.para: Tuple of the coarsened graph, coarsened graph edge weights (if edge_weight_view.has_value() is true) and the renumber map (if renumber is true).

memberdef.type: template std::tuple< graph_t< int32_t, int32_t, true, true >, std::optional< edge_property_t< graph_view_t< int32_t, int32_t, true, true >, float > >, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< int32_t > > >
memberdef.definition: template std::tuple< graph_t< int32_t, int32_t, true, true >, std::optional< edge_property_t< graph_view_t< int32_t, int32_t, true, true >, float > >, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< int32_t > > > cugraph::coarsen_graph
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< int32_t, int32_t, true, true > const &graph_view, std::optional< edge_property_view_t< int32_t, float const * > > edge_weight_view, int32_t const *labels, bool renumber, bool do_expensive_check)
memberdef.name: coarsen_graph

memberdef.definition: std::tuple< cugraph::graph_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu >, std::optional< edge_property_t< graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu >, weight_t > >, std::optional< edge_property_t< graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu >, edge_id_t > >, std::optional< edge_property_t< graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu >, edge_type_t > >, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > > > cugraph::create_graph_from_edgelist
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > > &&vertices, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > &&edgelist_srcs, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > &&edgelist_dsts, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< weight_t > > &&edgelist_weights, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< edge_id_t > > &&edgelist_edge_ids, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< edge_type_t > > &&edgelist_edge_types, graph_properties_t graph_properties, bool renumber, bool do_expensive_check)
memberdef.name: create_graph_from_edgelist

briefdescription.para: create a graph from (the optional vertex list and) the given edge list (with optional edge IDs and types).

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weight. Needs to be floating point type
Type of edge id. Needs to be an integral type
Type of edge type. Needs to be an integral type, currently only int32_t is supported
Flag indicating whether to use sources (if false) or destinations (if true) as major indices in storing edges using a 2D sparse matrix. transposed.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false) or multi-GPU (true).
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.

If valid, part of the entire set of vertices in the graph to be renumbered. This parameter can be used to include isolated vertices. If renumber is false and vertices is valid, vertices elements should be consecutive integers starting from 0. If multi-GPU, applying the compute_gpu_id_from_vertex_t to every vertex should return the local GPU ID for this function to work (vertices should be pre-shuffled).

Vector of edge source vertex IDs. If multi-GPU, applying the compute_gpu_id_from_ext_edge_endpoints_t to every edge should return the local GPU ID for this function to work (edges should be pre-shuffled).
Vector of edge destination vertex IDs.
Vector of weight values for edges
Vector of edge_id values for edges
Vector of edge_type values for edges
Properties of the graph represented by the input (optional vertex list and) edge list.
Flag indicating whether to renumber vertices or not (must be true if multi_gpu is true).
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

simplesect.para: Tuple of the generated graph and optional edge_property_t objects storing the provided edge properties and a renumber map (if renumber is true).

memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, std::optional< edge_property_view_t< edge_t, weight_t const * > > edge_weight_view, std::optional< edge_property_view_t< edge_t, edge_t const * > > edge_id_view, std::optional< edge_property_view_t< edge_t, edge_type_t const * > > edge_type_view, std::optional< raft::device_span< vertex_t const > > renumber_map, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: decompress_to_edgelist

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu > const &

briefdescription.para: Construct the edge list from the graph view object.

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights. Needs to be a floating point type.
Type of edge types. Needs to be an integral type.
Flag indicating whether to use sources (if false) or destinations (if true) as major indices in storing edges using a 2D sparse matrix. transposed.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false) or multi-GPU (true).
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Graph view object of the graph to be decompressed.
Optional view object holding edge weights for graph_view.
Optional view object holding edge ids for graph_view.
Optional view object holding edge types for graph_view.
If valid, return the renumbered edge list based on the provided renumber_map
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

simplesect.para: Tuple of edge sources, destinations, (optional) edge weights (if edge_weight_view.has_value() is true) and (optional) edge ids (if edge_id_view.has_value() is true).

memberdef.definition: rmm::device_uvector< weight_t > cugraph::compute_in_weight_sums
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, edge_property_view_t< edge_t, weight_t const * > edge_weight_view)
memberdef.name: compute_in_weight_sums

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu > const &

briefdescription.para: Compute per-vertex incoming edge weight sums.

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights. Needs to be a floating point type.
Flag indicating whether to use sources (if false) or destinations (if true) as major indices in storing edges using a 2D sparse matrix. transposed.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false) or multi-GPU (true).
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Graph view object of the input graph to compute per-vertex incoming edge weight sums.
View object holding edge weights for graph_view.

simplesect.para: Incoming edge weight sums for each vertex.

memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, std::optional< edge_property_view_t< edge_t, weight_t const * > > edge_weight_view, raft::device_span< size_t const > subgraph_offsets, raft::device_span< vertex_t const > subgraph_vertices, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: extract_induced_subgraphs

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu > const &

briefdescription.para: extract induced subgraph(s).

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights.
Flag indicating whether to use sources (if false) or destinations (if true) as major indices in storing edges using a 2D sparse matrix. transposed.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false) or multi-GPU (true).
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Graph view object, we extract induced subgraphs from graph_view.
Optional view object holding edge weights for graph_view.
Span pointing to subgraph vertex offsets

Span pointing to subgraph vertices. subgraph_offsets and subgraph_vertices provide vertex sets (or local vertex sets in multi-GPU) for subgraph_offsets.size() - 1 subgraphs to extract. For the i'th subgraph to extract, one can extract the (local-)vertex set by accessing a subset of subgraph_vertices, where the range of the subset is [subgraph_offsetes[i], subgraph_offsets[i + 1]). In multi-GPU, the vertex set for each subgraph is distributed in multiple-GPUs and each GPU holds only the vertices that are local to the GPU.
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

simplesect.para: Quadraplet of edge major (destination if store_transposed is true, source otherwise) vertices, edge minor (source if store_transposed is true, destination otherwise) vertices, edge weights (if edge_weight_view.has_value() is true), and edge offsets for each induced subgraphs (size == num_subgraphs + 1). The sizes of the edge major & minor vertices are edge_offsets[num_subgraphs].

memberdef.definition: void cugraph::relabel
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, std::tuple< vertex_t const *, vertex_t const * > old_new_label_pairs, vertex_t num_label_pairs, vertex_t *labels, vertex_t num_labels, bool skip_missing_labels, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: relabel

briefdescription.para: Relabel old labels to new labels.

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false) or multi-GPU (true).
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Pairs of an old label and the corresponding new label (each process holds only part of the entire old labels and the corresponding new labels; partitioning can be arbitrary).
Number of (old, new) label pairs.
Labels to be relabeled. This initially holds old labels. Old labels are updated to new labels in-place ([INOUT] parameter).
Number of labels to be relabeled.

Flag dictating the behavior on missing labels (labels contains old labels missing in old_new_label_pairs). If set to true, missing elements are skipped (not relabeled). If set to false, undefined behavior (if do_expensive_check is set to true, this function will throw an exception).
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

simplesect.para: rmm::device_uvector<vertex_t> New labels corresponding to the old_labels.

memberdef.name: remove_multi_edges

briefdescription.para: Remove all but one edge when a multi-edge exists.

detaileddescription.para: When a multi-edge exists, one of the edges will remain. If keep_min_value_edge is false, an arbitrary edge will be selected among the edges in the multi-edge. If keep_min_value_edge is true, the edge with the minimum value will be selected. The edge weights will be first compared (if edgelist_weights.has_value() is true); edge IDs will be compared next (if edgelist_edge_ids.has_value() is true); and edge types (if edgelist_edge_types.has_value() is true) will compared last.
In an MG context it is assumed that edges have been shuffled to the proper GPU, in which case any multi-edges will be on the same GPU.

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weight. Currently float and double are supported.
Type of edge type. Needs to be an integral type.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
List of source vertex ids
List of destination vertex ids
Optional list of edge weights
Optional list of edge ids
Optional list of edge types

Flag indicating whether to keep an arbitrary edge (false) or the minimum value edge (true) among the edges in a multi-edge. Relevant only if edgelist_weights.has_value() | edgelist_edge_ids.has_value() | edgelist_edge_types.has_value() is true. Setting this to true incurs performance overhead as this requires more comparisons.
