memberdef.definition: std::enable_if_t< multi_gpu, std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, renumber_meta_t< vertex_t, edge_t, multi_gpu > > > cugraph::renumber_edgelist
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > > &&local_vertices, std::vector< vertex_t * > const &edgelist_srcs, std::vector< vertex_t * > const &edgelist_dsts, std::vector< edge_t > const &edgelist_edge_counts, std::optional< std::vector< std::vector< edge_t > > > const &edgelist_intra_partition_segment_offsets, bool store_transposed, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: renumber_edgelist

briefdescription.para: renumber edgelist (multi-GPU)

detaileddescription.para: This function assumes that vertices are pre-shuffled to their target processes and edges are pre-shuffled to their target processess and edge partitions using compute_gpu_id_from_vertex_t and compute_gpu_id_from_ext_edge_endpoints_t & compute_partition_id_from_ext_edge_endpoints_t functors, respectively.

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false) or multi-GPU (true).
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.

If valid, part of the entire set of vertices in the graph to be renumbered. This parameter can be used to include isolated vertices. Applying the compute_gpu_id_from_vertex_t to every vertex should return the local GPU ID for this function to work (vertices should be pre-shuffled).

Pointers (one pointer per local edge partition assigned to this process) to edge source vertex IDs. Source IDs are updated in-place ([INOUT] parameter). Applying the compute_gpu_id_from_ext_edge_endpoints_t functor to every (destination ID, source ID) pair (if store_transposed = true) or (source ID, destination ID) pair (if store_transposed = false) should return the local GPU ID for this function to work (edges should be pre-shuffled). Applying the compute_partition_id_from_ext_edge_endpoints_t to every (destination ID, source ID) pair (if store_transposed = true) or (source ID, destination ID) pair (if store_transposed = false) should also return the corresponding edge partition ID. The best way to enforce this is to use shuffle_ext_vertex_pairs_to_local_gpu_by_edge_partitioning & groupby_and_count_edgelist_by_local_partition_id.
Pointers (one pointer per local edge partition assigned to this process) to edge destination vertex IDs. Destination IDs are updated in-place ([INOUT] parameter).
Edge counts (one count per local edge partition assigned to this process).

If valid, store segment offsets within a local edge partition; a local edge partition can be further segmented by applying the compute_gpu_id_from_vertex_t function to edge minor vertex IDs. This optinoal information is used for further memory footprint optimization if provided.
Should be true if renumbered edges will be used to create a graph with store_transposed = true. Should be false if the edges will be used to create a graph with store_transposed = false.
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

simplesect.para: std::tuple<rmm::device_uvector<vertex_t>, renumber_meta_t<vertex_t, edge_t, multi_gpu>> Tuple of labels (vertex IDs before renumbering) for the entire set of vertices (assigned to this process in multi-GPU) and meta-data collected while renumbering. The meta-data includes total number of vertices, total number of edges, partition_t object storing graph partitioning information, vertex partition segment offsets (a vertex partition is partitioned to multiple segments based on vertex degrees), and the number of local unique edge major & minor vertex IDs. This meta-data is expected to be used in graph construction & graph primitives.

memberdef.type: std::enable_if_t< !multi_gpu, std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, renumber_meta_t< vertex_t, edge_t, multi_gpu > > >
memberdef.definition: std::enable_if_t< !multi_gpu, std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, renumber_meta_t< vertex_t, edge_t, multi_gpu > > > cugraph::renumber_edgelist
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > > &&vertices, vertex_t *edgelist_srcs, vertex_t *edgelist_dsts, edge_t num_edgelist_edges, bool store_transposed, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: renumber_edgelist

Number of edges in the edgelist.

RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Pointer to the vertices to be renumbered. The input external vertices are renumbered to internal vertices in-place.
Number of vertices to be renumbered.
Pointer to the external vertices corresponding to the internal vertices in the range [local_int_vertex_first, local_int_vertex_last).
The first local internal vertex (inclusive, assigned to this process in multi-GPU).
The last local internal vertex (exclusive, assigned to this process in multi-GPU).
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

memberdef.name: unrenumber_local_int_edges

briefdescription.para: Unrenumber local edges' internal source & destination IDs to external IDs based on the provided renumber_map_labels (single-GPU).

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Flag indicating whether to use sources (if false) or destinations (if true) as major indices in storing edges using a 2D sparse matrix. transposed.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false) or multi-GPU (true).

RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms. @params edgelist_srcs Pointer to the local internal source vertex IDs to be unrenumbered. The input source vertex IDs are renumbered to external IDs in-place. @params edgelist_dsts Pointer to the local internal destination vertex IDs to be unrenumbered. The input destination vertex IDs are renumbered to external IDs in-place.
Number of edges in the edge list.
Pointer to the external vertices corresponding to the internal vertices.
Number of vertices to be unrenumbered.
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

memberdef.definition: rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > cugraph::select_random_vertices
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, std::optional< raft::device_span< vertex_t const > > given_set, raft::random::RngState &rng_state, size_t select_count, bool with_replacement, bool sort_vertices, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: select_random_vertices

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu > const &

briefdescription.para: Select random vertices.

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights. Needs to be a floating point type.
Flag indicating whether to use sources (if false) or destinations (if true) as major indices in storing edges using a 2D sparse matrix. transposed.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false) or multi-GPU (true).
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Graph view object of the input graph to select random vertices from.
Distributed set to sample from. If given_set is not specified, sample from the entire vertex range provided by graph_view.
The RngState instance holding pseudo-random number generator state.
The number of vertices to select from the graph
If true, select with replacement, if false select without replacement
If true, return the sorted vertices (in the ascending order).

simplesect.para: Device vector of selected vertices.

memberdef.definition: std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< weight_t > > > cugraph::symmetrize_edgelist
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > &&edgelist_srcs, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > &&edgelist_dsts, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< weight_t > > &&edgelist_weights, bool reciprocal)
memberdef.name: symmetrize_edgelist

briefdescription.para: Symmetrize edgelist.

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights. Needs to be a floating point type.
Flag indicating whether to use sources (if false) or destinations (if true) as major indices in storing edges using a 2D sparse matrix. transposed.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false) or multi-GPU (true).
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.

Vector of edge source vertex IDs. If multi-GPU, applying the compute_gpu_id_from_ext_edge_endpoints_t to every edge should return the local GPU ID for this function to work (edges should be pre-shuffled).
Vector of edge destination vertex IDs.
Vector of edge weights.
Flag indicating whether to keep (if set to false) or discard (if set to true) edges that appear only in one direction.

simplesect.para: std::tuple<rmm::device_uvector<vertex_t>, rmm::device_uvector<vertex_t>, std::optional<rmm::device_uvector<weight_t>>> Tuple of symmetrized sources, destinations, and optional weights (if edgelist_weights is valid).

memberdef.type: std::tuple< graph_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu >, std::optional< edge_property_t< graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu >, weight_t > >, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > > >
memberdef.definition: std::tuple< graph_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu >, std::optional< edge_property_t< graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu >, weight_t > >, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > > > cugraph::symmetrize_graph
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu > &&graph, std::optional< edge_property_t< graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu >, weight_t > > &&edge_weights, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > > &&renumber_map, bool reciprocal=false, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: symmetrize_graph

param.type: std::optional< edge_property_t< graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu >, weight_t > > &&

briefdescription.para: Symmetrize the input graph.

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights. Needs to be a floating point type.
Flag indicating whether to use sources (if false) or destinations (if true) as major indices in storing edges using a 2D sparse matrix. transposed.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false) or multi-GPU (true).
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Graph object to be symmetrized.
Optional owning object holding edge weights for graph.
Renumber map to recover the original vertex IDs from the renumbered vertex IDs. This should be valid if multi-GPU.
If true, an edge is kept only when the reversed edge also exists. If false, keep (and symmetrize) all the edges that appear only in one direction.
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

simplesect.para: Return a symmetrized graph, an owning object holding edge weights (if edge_weights.has_value() is true) and a new renumber map (to recover the original vertex IDs, if renumber_map.has_value() is true).

memberdef.type: std::tuple< graph_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu >, std::optional< edge_property_t< graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu >, weight_t > >, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > > >
memberdef.definition: std::tuple< graph_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu >, std::optional< edge_property_t< graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu >, weight_t > >, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > > > cugraph::transpose_graph
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu > &&graph, std::optional< edge_property_t< graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu >, weight_t > > &&edge_weights, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > > &&renumber_map, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: transpose_graph

param.type: std::optional< edge_property_t< graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu >, weight_t > > &&

briefdescription.para: Transpose the input graph.

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights. Needs to be a floating point type.
Flag indicating whether to use sources (if false) or destinations (if true) as major indices in storing edges using a 2D sparse matrix. transposed.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false) or multi-GPU (true).
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Graph object to be transposed.
Optional owning object holding edge weights for graph.
Renumber map to recover the original vertex IDs from the renumbered vertex IDs. This should be valid if multi-GPU.
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

simplesect.para: Return a transposed graph, an owning object holding edge weights (if edge_weights.has_value() is true) and a new renumber map (to recover the original vertex IDs, if renumber_map.has_value() is true).

memberdef.type: template std::tuple< graph_t< int32_t, int32_t, true, true >, std::optional< edge_property_t< graph_view_t< int32_t, int32_t, true, true >, float > >, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< int32_t > > >

memberdef.type: std::tuple< graph_t< vertex_t, edge_t, !store_transposed, multi_gpu >, std::optional< edge_property_t< graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, !store_transposed, multi_gpu >, weight_t > >, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > > >

memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu > &&graph, std::optional< edge_property_t< graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu >, weight_t > > &&edge_weights, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > > &&renumber_map, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: transpose_graph_storage

param.type: std::optional< edge_property_t< graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu >, weight_t > > &&

briefdescription.para: Transpose the storage format (no change in an actual graph topology).

detaileddescription.para: In SG, convert between CSR and CSC. In multi-GPU, currently convert between CSR + DCSR hybrid and CSC + DCSC hybrid (but the internal representation in multi-GPU is subject to change).

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights. Needs to be a floating point type.
Flag indicating whether to use sources (if false) or destinations (if true) as major indices in storing edges using a 2D sparse matrix. transposed.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false) or multi-GPU (true).
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Graph object to transpose its storage format.
Optional owning object holding edge weights for graph.
Renumber map to recover the original vertex IDs from the renumbered vertex IDs. This should be valid if multi-GPU.
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

simplesect.para: std::tuple<graph_t<vertex_t, edge_t, weight_t, !store_transposed, multi_gpu>,

Return a storage transposed graph, an owning object holding edge weights (if edge_weights.has_value() is true) and a new renumber map (to recover the original vertex IDs, if renumber_map.has_value() is true).

memberdef.type: template std::tuple< graph_t< int32_t, int32_t, false, true >, std::optional< edge_property_t< graph_view_t< int32_t, int32_t, false, true >, float > >, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< int32_t > > >

memberdef.definition: void cugraph::bfs
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, vertex_t *distances, vertex_t *predecessors, vertex_t const *sources, size_t n_sources=1, bool direction_optimizing=false, vertex_t depth_limit=std::numeric_limits< vertex_t >::max(), bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: bfs

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &

briefdescription.para: Run breadth-first search to find the distances (and predecessors) from the source vertex.

detaileddescription.para: This function computes the distances (minimum number of hops to reach the vertex) from the source vertex. If predecessors is not nullptr, this function calculates the predecessor of each vertex (parent vertex in the breadth-first search tree) as well.

parameterdescription.para: on erroneous input arguments.
Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false) or multi-GPU (true).
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Graph view object.
Pointer to the output distance array.
Pointer to the output predecessor array or nullptr.

Source vertices to start breadth-first search (root vertex of the breath-first search tree). If more than one source is passed, there must be a single source per component. In a multi-gpu context the source vertices should be local to this GPU.
number of sources (one source per component at most).

If set to true, this algorithm switches between the push based breadth-first search and pull based breadth-first search depending on the size of the breadth-first search frontier (currently unsupported). This option is valid only for symmetric input graphs.
Sets the maximum number of breadth-first search iterations. Any vertices farther than depth_limit hops from source_vertex will be marked as unreachable.
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

memberdef.definition: template void cugraph::bfs
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< int32_t, int32_t, false, true > const &graph_view, int32_t *distances, int32_t *predecessors, int32_t const *sources, size_t n_sources, bool direction_optimizing, int32_t depth_limit, bool do_expensive_check)

memberdef.definition: std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, vertex_t > cugraph::extract_bfs_paths
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, vertex_t const *distances, vertex_t const *predecessors, vertex_t const *destinations, size_t n_destinations)
memberdef.name: extract_bfs_paths

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &

briefdescription.para: Extract paths from breadth-first search output.

detaileddescription.para: This function extracts paths from the BFS output. BFS outputs distances and predecessors. The path from a vertex v back to the original source vertex can be extracted by recursively looking up the predecessor vertex until you arrive back at the original source vertex.

parameterdescription.para: on erroneous input arguments.
Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false) or multi-GPU (true).
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Graph view object.
Pointer to the distance array constructed by bfs.
Pointer to the predecessor array constructed by bfs.
Destination vertices, extract path from source to each of these destinations In a multi-gpu context the destination vertex should be local to this GPU.
number of destinations (one source per component at most).

simplesect.para: std::tuple<rmm::device_uvector<vertex_t>, vertex_t> pair containing the paths as a dense matrix in the vector and the maximum path length. Unused elements in the paths will be set to invalid_vertex_id (-1 for a signed vertex_t, std::numeric_limits<vertex_t>::max() for an unsigned vertex_t type).

memberdef.definition: template std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< int32_t >, int32_t > cugraph::extract_bfs_paths
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< int32_t, int32_t, false, true > const &graph_view, int32_t const *distances, int32_t const *predecessors, int32_t const *destinations, size_t n_destinations)

memberdef.definition: void cugraph::sssp
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, edge_property_view_t< edge_t, weight_t const * > edge_weight_view, weight_t *distances, vertex_t *predecessors, vertex_t source_vertex, weight_t cutoff=std::numeric_limits< weight_t >::max(), bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: sssp

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, false, multi_gpu > const &

briefdescription.para: Run single-source shortest-path to compute the minimum distances (and predecessors) from the source vertex.

detaileddescription.para: This function computes the distances (minimum edge weight sums) from the source vertex. If predecessors is not nullptr, this function calculates the predecessor of each vertex in the shortest-path as well. Graph edge weights should be non-negative.

parameterdescription.para: on erroneous input arguments.
Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights. Needs to be a floating point type.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false) or multi-GPU (true).
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
Graph view object.
View object holding edge weights for graph_view.
Pointer to the output distance array.
Pointer to the output predecessor array or nullptr.
Source vertex to start single-source shortest-path. In a multi-gpu context the source vertex should be local to this GPU.
Single-source shortest-path terminates if no more vertices are reachable within the distance of cutoff. Any vertex farther than cutoff will be marked as unreachable.
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

memberdef.definition: template void cugraph::sssp

memberdef.definition: std::unique_ptr< legacy::GraphCOO< vertex_t, edge_t, weight_t > > cugraph::minimum_spanning_tree
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, legacy::GraphCSRView< vertex_t, edge_t, weight_t > const &graph, rmm::device_async_resource_ref mr=rmm::mr::get_current_device_resource())
memberdef.name: minimum_spanning_tree

briefdescription.para: Generate edges in a minimum spanning forest of an undirected weighted graph.

detaileddescription.para: A minimum spanning tree is a subgraph of the graph (a tree) with the minimum sum of edge weights. A spanning forest is a union of the spanning trees for each connected component of the graph. If the graph is connected it returns the minimum spanning tree.

parameterdescription.para: when an error occurs.
Type of vertex identifiers. Supported value : int (signed, 32-bit)
Type of edge identifiers. Supported value : int (signed, 32-bit)
Type of edge weights. Supported values : float or double.
Library handle (RAFT). If a communicator is set in the handle,
input graph object (CSR) expected to be symmetric
Memory resource used to allocate the returned graph

simplesect.para: out_graph Unique pointer to MSF subgraph in COO format

memberdef.type: template std::unique_ptr< legacy::GraphCOO< int, int, float > >

memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, legacy::GraphCSRView< int, int, float > const &graph, rmm::device_async_resource_ref mr)
memberdef.name: minimum_spanning_tree< int, int, float >

memberdef.name: get_traversed_cost

briefdescription.para: Takes the results of BFS or SSSP function call and sums the given weights along the path to the starting vertex.

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weights. Needs to be a floating point type.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms. Must have at least one worker stream.
Pointer to vertex ids.
Pointer to predecessors.
Secondary weights along the edge from predecessor to vertex.
Contains for each index the sum of weights along the path unfolding.
Number of vertices.

Type of values. currently supported types are int32_t, int64_t, size_t, float and double.
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
List of vertex ids
List of values

memberdef.definition: void cugraph::jaccard
memberdef.argsstring: (legacy::GraphCSRView< VT, ET, WT > const &graph, WT const *weights, WT *result)
memberdef.name: jaccard

briefdescription.para: Compute jaccard similarity coefficient for all vertices.

detaileddescription.para: Computes the Jaccard similarity coefficient for every pair of vertices in the graph which are connected by an edge.

parameterdescription.para: when an error occurs.
Type of vertex identifiers. Supported value : int (signed, 32-bit)
Type of edge identifiers. Supported value : int (signed, 32-bit)
Type of edge weights. Supported value : float or double.
The input graph object
device pointer to input vertex weights for weighted Jaccard, may be NULL for unweighted Jaccard.
Device pointer to result values, memory needs to be pre-allocated by caller

memberdef.definition: void cugraph::jaccard_list
memberdef.argsstring: (legacy::GraphCSRView< VT, ET, WT > const &graph, WT const *weights, ET num_pairs, VT const *first, VT const *second, WT *result)
memberdef.name: jaccard_list

briefdescription.para: Compute jaccard similarity coefficient for selected vertex pairs.

detaileddescription.para: Computes the Jaccard similarity coefficient for each pair of specified vertices. Vertices are specified as pairs where pair[n] = (first[n], second[n])

parameterdescription.para: when an error occurs.
Type of vertex identifiers. Supported value : int (signed, 32-bit)
Type of edge identifiers. Supported value : int (signed, 32-bit)
Type of edge weights. Supported value : float or double.
The input graph object
The input vertex weights for weighted Jaccard, may be NULL for unweighted Jaccard.
The number of vertex ID pairs specified
Device pointer to first vertex ID of each pair
Device pointer to second vertex ID of each pair
Device pointer to result values, memory needs to be pre-allocated by caller

memberdef.definition: void cugraph::betweenness_centrality
memberdef.argsstring: (const raft::handle_t &handle, legacy::GraphCSRView< vertex_t, edge_t, weight_t > const &graph, result_t *result, bool normalized=true, bool endpoints=false, weight_t const *weight=nullptr, vertex_t k=0, vertex_t const *vertices=nullptr)
memberdef.name: betweenness_centrality

briefdescription.para: Compute betweenness centrality for a graph.

detaileddescription.para: Betweenness centrality for a vertex is the sum of the fraction of all pairs shortest paths that pass through the vertex.
The current implementation does not support a weighted graph.

parameterdescription.para: if result == nullptr or number_of_sources < 0 or number_of_sources !=0 and sources == nullptr.
Type of vertex identifiers. Supported value : int (signed, 32-bit)
Type of edge identifiers. Supported value : int (signed, 32-bit)
Type of edge weights. Supported values : float or double.
Type of computed result. Supported values : float or double
Library handle (RAFT). If a communicator is set in the handle, the multi GPU version will be selected.
cuGRAPH graph descriptor, should contain the connectivity information as a CSR
Device array of centrality scores
If true, return normalized scores, if false return unnormalized scores.
If true, include endpoints of paths in score, if false do not
If specified, device array of weights for each edge
If specified, number of vertex samples defined in the vertices array.
If specified, host array of vertex ids to estimate betweenness these vertices will serve as sources for the traversal algorihtm to obtain shortest path counters.
If specified use this number to normalize results when using subsampling, it allows accumulation of results across multiple calls.

memberdef.definition: void cugraph::edge_betweenness_centrality
memberdef.argsstring: (const raft::handle_t &handle, legacy::GraphCSRView< vertex_t, edge_t, weight_t > const &graph, result_t *result, bool normalized=true, weight_t const *weight=nullptr, vertex_t k=0, vertex_t const *vertices=nullptr)
memberdef.name: edge_betweenness_centrality

briefdescription.para: Compute edge betweenness centrality for a graph.

detaileddescription.para: Betweenness centrality of an edge is the sum of the fraction of all-pairs shortest paths that pass through this edge. The weight parameter is currenlty not supported

parameterdescription.para: if result == nullptr or number_of_sources < 0 or number_of_sources !=0 and sources == nullptr or endpoints == true.
Type of vertex identifiers. Supported value : int (signed, 32-bit)
Type of edge identifiers. Supported value : int (signed, 32-bit)
Type of edge weights. Supported values : float or double.
Type of computed result. Supported values : float or double
Library handle (RAFT). If a communicator is set in the handle, the multi GPU version will be selected.
cuGraph graph descriptor, should contain the connectivity information as a CSR
Device array of centrality scores
If true, return normalized scores, if false return unnormalized scores.
If specified, device array of weights for each edge
If specified, number of vertex samples defined in the vertices array.
If specified, host array of vertex ids to estimate betweenness these vertices will serve as sources for the traversal algorihtm to obtain shortest path counters.
If specified use this number to normalize results when using subsampling, it allows accumulation of results across multiple calls.

Type of graph
Library handle (RAFT). If a communicator is set in the handle,
input graph object
input dendrogram object
Pointer to device array where the clustering should be stored

memberdef.definition: std::tuple< graph_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu >, std::optional< edge_property_t< graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu >, weight_t > >, std::optional< edge_property_t< graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu >, edge_id_t > >, std::optional< edge_property_t< graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu >, edge_type_t > >, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > > > cugraph::create_graph_from_edgelist
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > > &&vertices, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > &&edgelist_srcs, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > &&edgelist_dsts, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< weight_t > > &&edgelist_weights, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< edge_id_t > > &&edgelist_edge_ids, std::optional< rmm::device_uvector< edge_type_t > > &&edgelist_edge_types, graph_properties_t graph_properties, bool renumber, bool do_expensive_check=false)
memberdef.name: create_graph_from_edgelist

briefdescription.para: create a graph from (the optional vertex list and) the given edge list (with optional edge IDs and types).

parameterdescription.para: Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge weight. Needs to be floating point type
Type of edge id. Needs to be an integral type
Type of edge type. Needs to be an integral type, currently only int32_t is supported
Flag indicating whether to use sources (if false) or destinations (if true) as major indices in storing edges using a 2D sparse matrix. transposed.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false) or multi-GPU (true).
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.

If valid, part of the entire set of vertices in the graph to be renumbered. This parameter can be used to include isolated vertices. If renumber is false and vertices is valid, vertices elements should be consecutive integers starting from 0. If multi-GPU, applying the compute_gpu_id_from_vertex_t to every vertex should return the local GPU ID for this function to work (vertices should be pre-shuffled).

Vector of edge source vertex IDs. If multi-GPU, applying the compute_gpu_id_from_ext_edge_endpoints_t to every edge should return the local GPU ID for this function to work (edges should be pre-shuffled).
Vector of edge destination vertex IDs.
Vector of weight values for edges
Vector of edge_id values for edges
Vector of edge_type values for edges
Properties of the graph represented by the input (optional vertex list and) edge list.
Flag indicating whether to renumber vertices or not (must be true if multi_gpu is true).
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).

simplesect.para: Tuple of the generated graph and optional edge_property_t objects storing the provided edge properties and a renumber map (if renumber is true).

memberdef.definition: std::tuple< rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t >, rmm::device_uvector< vertex_t > > cugraph::get_two_hop_neighbors
memberdef.argsstring: (raft::handle_t const &handle, graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu > const &graph_view, std::optional< raft::device_span< vertex_t const > > start_vertices)
memberdef.name: get_two_hop_neighbors

param.type: graph_view_t< vertex_t, edge_t, store_transposed, multi_gpu > const &

briefdescription.para: Find all 2-hop neighbors in the graph.

detaileddescription.para: Find pairs of vertices in the input graph such that each pair is connected by a path that is two hops in length.

parameterdescription.para: when an error occurs.
Type of vertex identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Type of edge identifiers. Needs to be an integral type.
Flag indicating whether to use sources (if false) or destinations (if true) as major indices in storing edges using a 2D sparse matrix. transposed.
Flag indicating whether template instantiation should target single-GPU (false) or multi-GPU (true).
RAFT handle object to encapsulate resources (e.g. CUDA stream, communicator, and handles to various CUDA libraries) to run graph algorithms.
The input graph object
Optional list of starting vertices to discover two-hop neighbors of

simplesect.para: tuple containing pairs of vertices that are 2-hops apart.
